name: Blue Hawkstrider
description: Some of our brethren prefer horses, but the hawkstrider will always be the true symbol of Silvermoon. -Winaestra

name: Diamond Mechsuit
description: These crystal-powered mechsuits are the epitome of Earthen Federation technology.

name: Coalfist Gronnling
description: This little gronnling is well-known for smashing his way into garrison inns and making a mess of the pots and pans.

name: Brown Wolf
description: Can howl loudly enough to be heard for miles.

name: Black War Raptor

name: White Stallion

name: Great Green Elekk

name: Purple Hawkstrider
description: Some of our brethren prefer horses, but the hawkstrider will always be the true symbol of Silvermoon. -Winaestra

name: Black War Tiger

name: Purple Elekk

name: Blue Mechanostrider

name: Red Wolf

name: Green Skeletal Warhorse
description: When fallen heroes are raised into undeath, so too are their horses.

name: Swift Purple Wind Rider
description: I still don't get why they fly faster when you put armor on them. -Drakma

name: Silver War Talbuk
description: Despite their docile nature, talbuks have been known to gore seasoned warriors to death when threatened.

name: Swift White Mechanostrider
description: We have made a lot of improvements, but they are still based on the Mekkatorque designs. -Milli Featherwhistle

name: Trained Meadowstomper
description: The draenei perfected elekk husbandry long ago, adorning the creatures with Light-infused crystals to make them more docile.

name: Red Skeletal Warhorse
description: When fallen heroes are raised into undeath, so too are their horses.

name: Swift Yellow Wind Rider
description: I still don't get why they fly faster when you put armor on them. -Drakma

name: Black Stallion
description: Rumored to be favored by SI:7 for night missions due to its dark coat.

name: Crusader's Black Warhorse
description: Awarded to only the most skilled champions from the Trial of the Crusader, these steeds were chosen for Horde members from Tirion Fordring's own personal stable.

name: Infernal Direwolf
description: A mighty wolf of Draenor, touched by the fel energies unleashed by Gul'dan in Tanaan Jungle. It has not gone completely mad... yet.

name: Armored Brown Bear
description: Your cries of "For the Horde!" will be much more menacing from atop a heavily armored bear that's barreling down on Alliance at top speed.

name: Black Ram
description: I've not seen this breed in in ages, but when they're ram tough they stick around. -Veron Amberstill

name: Swift Purple Gryphon
description: The Horde had dragons, we had the gryphons. We won that war. - Ilsa Blusterbrew

name: Vicious War Riverbeast
description: Riverbeasts are actually one of the most dangerous animals on Azeroth, despite their appearance.

name: Violet Raptor
description: Bred from the fiercest stock anywhere and guaranteed not to bite (much).

name: Wick
description: Rescued from the ruthless charge of Ol' Waxbeard and the looming threat of The Darkness, now able to nibble on loose wax in peace.

name: Winter Wolf
description: Ancient furbolg legends claim that wolves born with a white coat are blessed by Azeroth's two moons.

name: Great Purple Elekk
description: An alpha member of the herd, this elekk is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through Northern Nagrand.

name: Shadowblade's Baneful Omen
description: For the toxin-inclined.

name: Brown Horse
description: A favorite among Stormwind's guards thanks to its patience and stamina.

name: Lightforged Felcrusher
description: A gift of thanks from the Lightforged draenei, this stalwart elekk is conditioned to charge headlong into darkness without fear.

name: Honeyback Harvester
description: While most Harvesters dream only of honey and flowers, this adventurous specimen looks to the wide world beyond Stormsong Valley.

name: Charger
description: Redeemed by the Light. Devoted to your cause.

name: Undying Darkhound
description: The Undying Darkhound's parts have graced many battlefields, yet this latest battle may have been the first time they all fought together.

name: Mechano-Hog
description: Difficult to build and to maintain, these hogs more than make up for their expense through sheer cool factor.

name: Dire Wolf
description: Once thought to be extinct except in the far north. Highly sought by those preparing for winter.

name: Swift Green Wind Rider
description: I still don't get why they fly faster when you put armor on them. -Drakma

name: Black War Wolf
description: Prized by Orgrimmar guards for their keen sense of smell.

name: Warstitched Darkhound
description: These warhounds are crafted by the House of Constructs to carry any rider into the thick of battle, rending and tearing enemy mounts all the while.

name: Swift Red Wind Rider
description: I still don't get why they fly faster when you put armor on them. -Drakma

name: Swift Mistsaber
description: Some historians claim that this breed's misty grey coat is the result of ancient Highborne experiments conducted on nightsabers.

name: Swift White Steed
description: A veteran of some of the toughest battles fought by the Argent Crusade.

name: Black War Ram
description: The dwarves value their ram companions for their fearlessness charging into battle.

name: Warforged Nightmare
description: A nightmarish steed of hardened steel and vengeful spirits, this companion will follow you to the depths of the Firelands and back without complaint.

name: Swift Green Gryphon
description: The Horde had dragons, we had the gryphons. We won that war. - Ilsa Blusterbrew

name: Thalassian Warhorse
description: A loyal companion to any who would protect Silvermoon.

name: Timber Wolf
description: Can howl loudly enough to be heard for miles.

name: Black Wolf
description: Can howl loudly enough to be heard for miles.

name: Chestnut Mare
description: Sturdy and steady; "the horse that built Stormwind."

name: Red Skeletal Horse
description: The Forsaken believe that without a purpose, even beasts of burden suffer in undeath.

name: Sunstone Panther
description: Legends say that an ancient pandaren emperor crafted the first jeweled panther for his son after the boy's twin brother died of an illness.

name: Armored Razzashi Raptor
description: The purebred royal raptors of Zul'Gurub, these mounts have become a rare sight in Stranglethorn Vale. The Gurubashi have been known to fly into a rage at the sight of any non-troll riding one of their precious beasts.

name: Black War Kodo
description: Bred for their aggressive, unpredictable demeanor by the Kor'kron stablemasters, the Black War Kodos' trumpeting call signifies that blood will soon be shed.

name: Brown Kodo
description: "The kodo is the backbone of our people. Wherever the Horde goes - in trade, settlement, or war - there you will find the mighty kodo." - Harb Clawhoof

name: Black War Steed
description: Trained to withstand brutal hand-to-hand combat in the fiercest battlefields.

name: Unshackled Waveray
description: The Unshackled have a natural kinship with the species of the deep seas that have seen cruelty at the hands of the naga.

name: Swift Blue Raptor
description: Longtime allies of the trolls, these jungle hunters form a special bond with their masters. They become steed, guardian, and friend.

name: Ice Mammoth
description: The Sons of Hodir believe that riding an ice-white mammoth will protect the rider from frostbite and snow blindness.

name: Gray Ram
description: Male rams will often smash their thick skulls against each other for hours to impress a female. In that way, they're very similar to dwarves.

name: Gray Wolf
description: This breed of wolf prefers hunting in the fog, relying on its smoky hide to camouflage it from unsuspecting prey.

name: Swift Yellow Mechanostrider
description: We have made a lot of improvements, but they are still based on the Mekkatorque designs. -Milli Featherwhistle

name: Swift Red Gryphon
description: The Horde had dragons, we had the gryphons. We won that war. - Ilsa Blusterbrew

name: Dawnforge Ram

name: Rivendare's Deathcharger

name: Sharkbait
description: Sharkbait's loyalty lies with whomever keeps the crackers coming.

name: Swift Palomino
description: Prized by horse breeders for their discipline and steadfastness.

description: "The terradynamic exo-plotters are conjoined by hydraulic imaging to the equilibrium enhancers..." -Binjy Featherwhistle

name: Shadowblade's Lethal Omen
description: They'll never hear you coming.

description: "The kodo is the backbone of our people. Wherever the Horde goes - in trade, settlement, or war - there you will find the mighty kodo." - Harb Clawhoof

description: "The kodo is the backbone of our people. Wherever the Horde goes - in trade, settlement, or war - there you will find the mighty kodo." - Harb Clawhoof

name: Swift Purple Hawkstrider
description: Their plumage is more beautiful than any other. Subtlety is for the birds! I mean... other birds. -Viera Sunwhisper

name: Black Hawkstrider
description: Some of our brethren prefer horses, but the hawkstrider will always be the true symbol of Silvermoon. -Winaestra

name: Amber Skitterfly
description: A gift from Granpap Whiskers to the Trading Post, amber skitterflies are remarkably docile.

name: Swift Green Hawkstrider
description: Their plumage is more beautiful than any other. Subtlety is for the birds! I mean... other birds. -Viera Sunwhisper

name: Red Hawkstrider
description: Some of our brethren prefer horses, but the hawkstrider will always be the true symbol of Silvermoon. -Winaestra

name: Wicked Swarmer
description: When the Void reached out, the Aqir were formed in its terrible image.

name: Swift Warstrider
description: You watch what happens when their master is attacked and you will see those birds in a whole new light. - Raider Bork

name: Vicious War Bear

name: Frostplains Battleboar
description: If it didn't have the cool tusk ring, it would feel so silly in that outfit.

name: Squawks
description: Guess why he's called that? It's not because he's a nice, quiet pet.

name: Voldunai Dunescraper
description: These brightly-colored fliers are rarely captured in the wild due to their naturally untrusting natures.

name: Swift Olive Raptor
description: Longtime allies of the trolls, these jungle hunters form a special bond with their masters. They become mount, guardian, and friend.

name: Malevolent Gladiator's Cloud Serpent

name: Fiery Warhorse
description: Was one of the most vicious steeds stabled in Karazhan.

name: Black Qiraji Battle Tank
description: Although many varieties of Qiraji Battle Tank can still be found in the ruins of Ahn'Qiraj today, the darkest of the species were only seen on the day the Scarab gong was rung.

name: Green Kodo
description: An alpha member of the herd, this kodo is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through Desolace.

name: Sunwalker Kodo
description: This magnificent beast, adorned in sacred charms and painted with holy imagery, radiates with the warmth of the sun.

name: Great Gray Kodo
description: An alpha member of the herd, this kodo is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through Desolace.

name: Swift Zulian Panther
description: The jungle trolls have long coveted panther fangs, using them for rituals or as ingredients in mojos.

name: Mottled Red Raptor
description: Bred from the fiercest stock anywhere and guaranteed not to bite (much).

name: Black Ram
description: I've not seen this breed in in ages, but when they're ram tough they stick around. -Veron Amberstill

name: Predatory Bloodgazer
description: The sheer amount of raw red berries these fierce omnivores consume gives them their distinctive eye color.

name: Purple Netherwing Drake
description: After promising to fly you to the ends of Outland, the netherwing drake was eventually drawn to the blue skies of Azeroth as well.

name: Purple Skeletal Warhorse
description: When fallen heroes are raised into undeath, so too are their horses.

name: Desire's Battle Gargon
description: The Countess maintains a small stable of elegantly adorned gargon mounts for her sole use. Many a rival has been taken in by the finery to their peril as she personally oversees their deadly training.

name: Amethyst Ruinstrider
description: Talbuks, native to Argus, have evolved chitinous plates to survive the decades of ceaseless war that ravages the landscape.

name: Crimson Mudnose
description: Frequently used by kobolds as mounts, the Assembly of the Deeps has decided to allow you access to one of their most loyal mudnoses.

name: Swift Orange Raptor
description: Longtime allies of the trolls, these jungle hunters form a special bond with their masters. They become mount, guardian, and friend.

name: Time-Lost Proto-Drake
description: The only reason for time is so that everything doesn't happen at once.

name: Great White Kodo
description: A rare albino of the species first spotted in Desolace.  The centaur claim that a white kodo is a harbinger of doom.

name: Bonesewn Fleshroc
description: Only expert flesh-stitchers who have demonstrated mastery over the magics of Maldraxxus are powerful enough to construct a deathroc of this size.

name: Brown Ram
description: Male rams will often smash their thick skulls against each other for hours to impress a female. In that way, they're very similar to dwarves.

name: White Ram
description: Male rams will often smash their thick skulls against each other for hours to impress a female. In that way, they're very similar to dwarves.

name: Blue Qiraji War Tank
description: The Qiraji War Tank has only been seen recently during the Call of the Scarab, could this hint at a resurfacing of the deadly creatures?

name: Wild Glimmerfur Prowler
description: This prowler's brilliant green coat distinguishes it from the blues and purples of Ardenweald, making it much easier for others of its kind to see through the midnight woods.

name: Green Mechanostrider
description: "The terradynamic exo-plotters are conjoined by hydraulic imaging to the equilibrium enhancers..." -Binjy Featherwhistle

name: Swift Zulian Tiger
description: The last known Zulian tigers were kept by High Priest Thekal, deep within Zul'Gurub.  They are said to have been hunted into extinction.

name: Great Sunwalker Kodo
description: At daybreak, the noble Sunwalkers often perform rituals to bless their mounts, imbuing them with holy magic.

name: Winter Wilderling
description: Wilderlings serve as support units in battle, preserving their allies and rendering enemy magics useless.

name: Blue Skeletal Horse
description: The Forsaken believe that without a purpose, even beasts of burden suffer in undeath.

name: Swift Brown Wolf
description: The wolves of the Horde are befriended, not domesticated.

name: Vicious Black Bonesteed
description: These skeletal steeds know no fear, eat no grains, and can travel impossible distances.

name: Malevolent Drone
description: The Aqir drones feast on heroes and cowards alike to grow their ranks.

name: Frostwolf Howler
description: Raised in the Alterac Mountains by the Frostwolf Clan.

name: Silver Riding Nether Ray
description: Nether Rays are among the most trusted, versatile mounts in all of Outland and beyond.

name: Sureki Skyrazor
description: The skyrazor was one of the most vicious abominations to emerge from Queen Ansurek's experiments with the Black Blood of the Old Gods.

name: Silver Covenant Hippogryph
description: Silver Covenant Hippogryphs are fiercely loyal, both to their riding partners, and to the Alliance.

name: Red Riding Nether Ray
description: Nether Rays are among the most trusted, versatile mounts in all of Outland and beyond.

name: Dread Raven
description: Filled with the hatred of an ancient god, the dread raven are the Arakkoa's most trusted guardians.

name: Rampart Screecher
description: Roosting among the ramparts of Castle Nathria, these giant dredbats act as sentinels and are trained to take down threats approaching the castle from the air.

name: Champion's Treadblade
description: Forged by human, gnome, and dwarf, this armored masterpiece is designed to slice a tauren into a tri-tip dinner with a flick of the handlebars.

name: Battle Gargon Vrednic
description: Prince Renathal's loyal gargon, Vrednic has been by his side for millennia. Adorned in his Sinvyr armor, Vrednic's mere presence instills terror to all those who lay eyes on him as he ushers his rider into battle.

name: Eternal Phalynx of Purity
description: The armored phalynx is a favorite companion of the mightiest warriors of the Ascended as it is both fearless and vicious in battle.

name: Biletooth Gnasher
description: Its bite is definitely worse than its bark-like gurgling sound.

name: Great Brown Kodo
description: An alpha member of the herd, this kodo is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through the Northern Barrens.

name: Brutal Nether Drake
description: The most aggressive nether drakes were awarded those heroes who showed significant prowess and commitment in the gladiatorial arena.

name: Alabaster Hyena
description: These hyena are used by the Voldunai to quickly move unseen throughout the sands.

name: Red Mechanostrider
description: "The terradynamic exo-plotters are conjoined by hydraulic imaging to the equilibrium enhancers..." -Binjy Featherwhistle

name: Winterspring Frostsaber
description: Taming this savage breed requires patience, strength, and a large supply of fake mice and twine.

name: Blue Mechanostrider
description: "The terradynamic exo-plotters are conjoined by hydraulic imaging to the equilibrium enhancers..." -Binjy Featherwhistle

name: Dauntless Duskrunner
description: The Path of Ascension is a challenging trial, and those that display all of the facets the Kyrian hold dear will be duly rewarded.

name: Hellfire Infernal
description: From the bowels of the nether is summoned a creature of pure hatred, bent on burning down any life in its way.

name: Blue Dragon Turtle
description: Cherished for their heavy carrying capacity and steady gait, these stalwart beasts are the mount of choice for most native Pandaren.

name: Zandalari Direhorn
description: The Zandalari pride themselves on being the first to raise and train all of the most ferocious lizards on Azeroth.

name: Crimson Cloud Serpent
description: Crimson Cloud Serpents are given to flights of fancy, striking out on a whim for seemingly random journeys, sometimes for days at a time.

name: Iron Skyreaver
description: Iron Horde beastmasters bred this rylak for war and then girded it for battle in black steel and smoldering flame.

name: Cobalt War Talbuk
description: Despite their docile nature, talbuks have been known to gore seasoned warriors to death when threatened.

name: Pestilent Necroray
description: When a necroray hatches, spores fly everywhere, making a huge mess.

name: Aerial Unit R-21/X
description: King Mechagon's private aerial unit, complete with deployable blast cannon and foot warmers.

name: Conqueror's Scythemaw
description: The battle-hardened shell of this mighty beast can turn aside even the most hefty hammer or sharpened spear.

name: Vile Fiend
description: Infused with acidic blood through a terrifying ritual, you can feel your control over this beast is tenuous at best.

name: Lightforged Warframe
description: The Army of the Light conducts quick, brutal hit-and-run attacks using these agile war machines.

name: Amber Ardenmoth
description: The brilliant orange hue of the amber ardenmoth signals to predators that it is dangerous to eat. Consuming one of these creatures will put a predator into a dreamless sleep for years.

name: Hand of Hrestimorak
description: The treachery of Hrestimorak was infamous, betraying his people to claim power. Facing damnation in the Maw, he tried to subvert the Jailer... a foolish act that would earn him an eternity of torment.

name: Siesbarg
description: Poor guy.

name: Bristling Hellboar
description: The one and only source for the rare culinary ingredient: cursed bacon.

name: Highmountain Elderhorn
description: The favored mount of Highmountain hunters, they can easily leap across the rushing rivers of Pinerock Basin even when saddled with a full-sized Tauren.

name: Ferocious Gladiator's Storm Dragon
description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

name: Teldrassil Hippogryph
description: One of the last of the great armored hippogryphs to escape the burning of Teldrassil, it carried the last few citizens it could to safety before collapsing of exhaustion.

name: Striped Frostsaber
description: This hearty mount's ferocious appetite earned it the nickname "Dragon Belly" in the night elf language.

name: Mawsworn Charger
description: The fate of all horse mounts.

name: Beryl Ruinstrider
description: Talbuks, native to Argus, have evolved chitinous plates to survive the decades of ceaseless war that ravages the landscape.

name: Chosen Tauralus
description: Even an unarmored tauralus is a valuable ally in battle, its enormous horns capable of piercing even plate armor.

name: Cobalt Primordial Direhorn
description: "When ya fight alongside raptors, ya want a mount dey can't eat." -Unknown dinomancer

name: Black Qiraji Battle Tank
description: Although many varieties of Qiraji Battle Tank can still be found in the ruins of Ahn'Qiraj today, the darkest of the species were only seen on the day the Scarab gong was rung.

name: Wooly White Rhino
description: Captured by Toby "Mother Goose" Ironbolt on the Borean Tundra, this shaggy beast carries an enormous grudge after being bridled by a gnome.

name: Vicious War Wolf
description: At Warchief Hellscream's command, Horde trainers began raising wolves to thrive in the shock and ferocity of sustained combat.

name: Swift Stormsaber
description: Rumor has it that this breed was named after the renowned archdruid Malfurion Stormrage.

name: Bone-White Primal Raptor
description: "They are lethal at eight months, very lethal." -Hemet Nesingwary Jr.

name: Red Dragon Turtle
description: Cherished for their heavy carrying capacity and steady gait, these stalwart beasts are the mount of choice for most native Pandaren.

name: Jungle Riding Crane
description: A beloved mount in southern Pandaria, the jungle crane is known for its speed and agility honed over a lifetime of avoiding Krasari tigers.

name: Swift Forest Strider
description: This vibrant breed can only be found in the forests of Darkmoon Island.

name: Sapphire Panther
description: Legends say that an ancient pandaren emperor crafted the first jeweled panther for his son after the boy's twin brother died of an illness.

name: Black Dragon Turtle
description: Cherished for their heavy carrying capacity and steady gait, these stalwart beasts are the mount of choice for most native Pandaren.

name: Feldrake
description: Fighting the Burning Legion millennia ago, this valiant drake fell to corruption after its body was infused with raw demonic magic.

name: Vicious Dreamtalon
description: This feline beast's preferred prey is the Horde.

name: Great Black Dragon Turtle
description: "Packaged upgrades include; dual-lantern fog lights, emergency brew keg, and genuine Tanji leather seat."  - Turtlemaster Odai

name: Orgrimmar Wolf
description: For a brief time, many orcs would declare themselves "hungry like an Orgrimmar wolf." Some blood elves still use the phrase ironically.

name: Subdued Seahorse
description: "One has not truly lived until they have felt the tidal current rushing through their hair while atop a majestic seahorse," said no one.  Ever.

name: Red Drake
description: You should never listen to minstrels' fancies. A dragon would never hurt a soul, unless they tried to hurt him first.

name: Great Purple Dragon Turtle
description: "Packaged upgrades include; dual-lantern fog lights, emergency brew keg, and genuine Tanji leather seat."  - Turtlemaster Odai

name: Modest Expedition Yak
description: Unlike its burden-bearing kin, this yak prefers to travel light and go no more than a mile at a time.

name: Jade Primordial Direhorn
description: The festive coloring belies deadly intent.

name: Anu'relos, Flame's Guidance
description: Though her feathers flicker with flame's destructive potential, they do not scorch, but simply radiate a comfortable heat.

name: Azure Water Strider
description: "Normally bugs are for bait, but how could you look into its eyes and even think that?" -Nat Pagle

name: Blossoming Dreamstag
description: The pelts of young dreamstags flower with the vibrant colors of the dream.

name: Thundering Ruby Cloud Serpent
description: From their infancy, Thundering Cloud Serpents are drawn to storms. They have been known to chase lightning through the blackened, roiling clouds, and to bathe in the pouring rain.

name: Sulfur Hound
description: The Black Empire subjugated these humbled and hateful hounds. Utterly obedient, they still serve the strong.

name: Delugen
description: Imagine being so engrossed by a dream that it feels real; some might even call it a delusion.

name: Vicious War Snail
description: The Horde uses these ravenous snail mounts to traverse over any obstacle in battlefields.

name: Black Riding Goat
description: It takes unflagging patience and a gentle touch to train obstinate mountain goats for riding.

name: Azure Worldchiller
description: In the corners of Azeroth, stories are told of a dreaded dragon who swept a pall of torment over the land. In some versions of this story, his fiery presence brought cataclysmic death and destruction worldwide. In other versions, he is blue.

name: Cindermane Charger
description: Formed by Ragnaros himself as a gift for the daughter he never had.

name: Slate Primordial Direhorn
description: The masks aren't to control the direhorn; they are so no one sees your face when it turns on you.

name: Regal Riding Crane
description: The crane is a symbol of wisdom and nobility. Their ability to carry us into the skies is nothing short of miraculous. - Jaluu the Generous

name: Red Shado-Pan Riding Tiger
description: "When waking a tiger, use a long stick. Better yet, tell your friend to wake the tiger instead." -Pandaren Proverb

name: Brown Riding Goat
description: It takes unflagging patience and a gentle touch to train obstinate mountain goats for riding.

name: Swift Horde Wolf
description: A few of the Argent Crusade's swiftest mounts were awarded to those members of the Horde who performed exceptionally during the tournament in Icecrown.

name: Delver's Dirigible
description: This aircraft will help you delve straight into adventure, wherever it may be!

name: Ruby Panther
description: Legends say that an ancient pandaren emperor crafted the first jeweled panther for his son after the boy's twin brother died of an illness.

name: Great Green Dragon Turtle
description: "Packaged upgrades include; dual-lantern fog lights, emergency brew keg, and genuine Tanji leather seat."  - Turtlemaster Odai

name: Spectral Gryphon
description: When you said an old friend was coming back, this was not quite what I expected. -Bralla Cloudwing

name: White Riding Goat
description: It takes unflagging patience and a gentle touch to train obstinate mountain goats for riding.

name: Life-Binder's Handmaiden
description: Alexstrasza, the former dragon Aspect of Life, is known to be a kind and patient mentor. Under her tutelage, only the most dedicated pupils acquire the title of "Life-Binder's Handmaiden."

name: Black Riding Yak
description: Grummles traveling Kun-Lai Summit by night prefer to ride this dark-haired yak to remain unseen, though they remove the bells from its caparison first.

name: Jeweled Onyx Panther
description: Trade Prince Gallywix recently ordered dozens of these glittering jewel-encrusted mounts to roam the grounds of his pleasure palace.

name: Azure Skitterfly
description: Once Granpap Whiskers finally taught them how to take riders, the azure skitterflies proved to bond closely and loyally to their riders.

name: Corrupted Hippogryph
description: It is a sad fact that even the wise and majestic hippogryph may fall prey to corruption.

name: Vicious War Steed
description: Armored to withstand collisions in battle.

name: Blonde Riding Yak
description: Riding Yaks are bred to be slimmer and more agile than their kin.

name: Crimson Water Strider
description: "Normally bugs are for bait, but how could you look into its eyes and even think that?" -Nat Pagle

name: Jade Pandaren Kite
description: The residents of Pandaria salute your enthusiasm for wildlife preservation. They do have concerns about housing 150 animals per visit, though.

name: White Riding Camel
description: Fennimore Quigley is credited with milking the first camel and breaking the record for "longest unintentional flight," all in the same afternoon.

name: Experiment 12-B
description: Some believe Experiment 12-B is the result of a covert SI-7 initiative, others consider it the outcome of embyronic tinkering by goblin scientists. No matter the case, this much is certain: given its strength, speed and agility, Experiment 12-B was a success!

name: Jeweled Copper Scarab
description: The rulers of desert kingdoms would attune crystals to their personal mounts for quick summoning.

name: Quel'dorei Steed
description: Comes from a lineage of fine horses that once grazed near the shores of the Well of Eternity.

name: Renewed Proto-Drake
description: As the isles awaken, these proto-drakes answer the call to soar the skies alongside mortals.

name: Brown Dragon Turtle
description: Cherished for their heavy carrying capacity and steady gait, these stalwart beasts are the mount of choice for most native Pandaren.

name: Swift Alliance Steed
description: A few of the Argent Crusade's swiftest mounts were awarded to those members of the Alliance who performed exceptionally during the tournament in Icecrown.

name: Steamscale Incinerator
description: A mad gnomish inventor had a dream to ride a dragon, so he created this metal monstrosity. He powered it with a trapped demon, in order to create "an authentic dragon soul," and did not survive its activation.

name: Grand Wyvern
description: Wyverns hail from some of the most inhospitable regions of Kalimdor, making them masters of adapting to any environment.

name: Jade, Bright Foreseer
description: The presence of this majestic Pandaren rabbit spirit brings joy and happiness and is heralded as a wonderful omen. Legend says that in its eyes, you can glimpse the greatest happiness of your life, even if it is yet to come.

name: Ironbound Proto-Drake
description: His skin more hard than brass was found, that sword nor spear could pierce nor wound.

name: Grand Armored Wyvern
description: This ferocious beast, renowned among wyvern handlers, was one of the first mounts chosen to take part in the Horde's Dominance Offensive.

name: Jade Panther
description: Legends say that an ancient pandaren emperor crafted the first jeweled panther for his son after the boy's twin brother died of an illness.

name: Sky Golem
description: A glorious feat of engineering, the sky golem takes traditional shredder technology to a whole new level (and altitude!).

name: Swift Springstrider
description: The joys of Noblegarden are best when celebrated with this loyal, loving, and blandly-colored freak of nature.

name: Raptora Swooper
description: The raptora swooper is one of the most vicious iterations of its kind, perfectly suited for its ecological niche. Needing no further adjustments, the ones synthesized today are identical to those created in the past.

name: Swift Purple Raptor
description: Longtime allies of the trolls, these jungle hunters form a special bond with their masters. They become mount, guardian, and friend.

name: Wooly Mammoth
description: This wild variant of the mammoth is not bred for riding. Most wooly mammoths are captured in the wild and tamed by their riders, resulting in a fierce, cunning mount.

name: Flametalon of Alysrazor
description: As with their matriarch, Alysrazor, the fury and fervor of these elemental avians are unquenchable.

name: Vicious Gladiator's Twilight Drake
description: Heroes who proved their might in the gladiatorial arenas during the Cataclysm were awarded the most exceptional of the twilight drake broods.

name: Green Wind Rider
description: After being freed from vicious harpies by Cairne and Thrall, many of these creatures became valuable companions of the Horde.

name: Green Dragon Turtle
description: Cherished for their heavy carrying capacity and steady gait, these stalwart beasts are the mount of choice for most native Pandaren.

name: Thunder Bluff Kodo
description: An alpha member of the herd, this kodo is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through Mulgore.

name: Obsidian Nightwing
description: When you can't run, you crawl, and when you can't crawl you find someone to carry you.

name: Mimiron's Head
description: A token of titan craftsmanship hoarded by the Old God, Yogg-Saron. Currently the single largest mechanical gnome head in Azeroth.

name: Ice Mammoth
description: Many ice giants claim that they have trained their favored white mammoths to trigger avalanches with their trumpeting calls.

name: Azure Drake
description: Always speak politely to an enraged dragon.

name: Plunderlord's Golden Crocolisk
description: What is a Plunderlord without a proper display of plunder?

name: Blue Drake
description: Come not between the dragon and his wrath.

name: Winged Guardian
description: Unearthed recently in an ancient tomb, this mighty winged lion may have once served one of the ancient Tol'vir princes.

name: Yellow War Ottuk
description: The yellow ottuks of the Azure Span are sleek, sneaky, and smart. Those trained for war are the finest tuskarr cavalry mounts, equally capable on the ground and in the waters.

name: Swift Violet Ram
description: The Barak Tor'ol ram's thick bony skull and massive horns make it the ideal mount for charging through groups of armored enemies.

name: Swift Mountain Horse
description: Longs for the day it may return to its home in Gilneas.

name: Cobalt Juggernaut
description: What started as a rideable mining and logging machine devolved quickly into chaos when engineers asked themselves if they could make it any cooler.

name: Shadow Dusk Dreamsaber
description: A dreamsaber strikes quickly from the shadows, capturing small animals and slipping back into darkness without a sound. The lucky few who have seen a feeding dreamsaber can see them revel in lazily toying with their prey before beginning their meal.

name: Armored Brown Bear
description: This ursine mount's swiftness is enhanced by its heavy armor, imbued with magic from Kirin Tor magi.

name: Forsaken Warhorse
description: When fallen heroes are raised into undeath, so too are their horses.

name: Wooly Mammoth
description: Directly descended from the original progenitor of the mammoth race, wooly mammoths are considered more feral and primal than their shorter-haired cousins.

name: Plagued Proto-Drake
description: Bred specifically to honor those heroes who showed significant courage and persistence facing the dangers in Northrend.

name: Red Proto-Drake
description: The vrykul were the first to recognize their potential. Or maybe the second, depending on how you look at it.

name: Stormhide Salamanther
description: Sometimes when storm energies infuse a creature, it simply... becomes larger and more placid. Few salamanthers are willing to be ridden, but these children of the storm are a notable exception.

name: Silvermoon Hawkstrider
description: So I says I feel like chicken tonight. Next thing, I am flat out and that thing is trying to see what my eyes taste like. -Bozzle Blastbolt

name: Mekgineer's Chopper
description: Sporting superb engineering craftsmanship, this chopper is one of the few personal vehicles on Azeroth built for two.

name: Swift Lovebird
description: It's like red but not quite.

name: Grand Caravan Mammoth
description: A common sight on trade routes all across Azeroth, this calm, stalwart mount is the favorite of merchants traveling to exotic and distant markets.

name: Purple Dragon Turtle
description: Cherished for their heavy carrying capacity and steady gait, these stalwart beasts are the mount of choice for most native Pandaren.

name: Darkmoon Dancing Bear
description: These fearsome mounts have a habit of suddenly breaking out into dance amid battle, much to the annoyance of their riders.

name: Luxurious Riding Crane
description: A majestic bird, but a rather picky eater.

name: Gorestrider Gronnling
description: Once "befriended", a gronnling will happily carry its rider to their death.

name: Tyrael's Charger
description: A symbol of justice throughout all known realms.

name: Violet Pandaren Phoenix
description: The Violet Phoenix's plumage is said to symbolize a union of opposing forces.

name: Talont
description: Some daydreams are filled with wondrous possibilities, but shatter when reminded of reality's limitations. Some dreams are not so burdened, even when they carry a rider.

name: Green Proto-Drake
description: The vrykul were the first to recognize their potential. Or maybe the second, depending on how you look at it.

name: Royal Snapdragon
description: Captured at a young age and raised to serve naga hunters, snapdragons are loyal and fierce companions.

name: Swift Brewfest Ram
description: Dwarves attribute this breed's even temperament to rigorous training, but other races argue that a daily diet of strong ale has something to do with it.

name: Cataclysmic Gladiator's Twilight Drake
description: Heroes who proved their might in the gladiatorial arenas during the Cataclysm were awarded the most exceptional of the twilight drake broods.

name: Winged Steed of the Ebon Blade
description: Dead or alive, you're coming with me.

name: Frenzied Feltalon
description: The Legion experimented with the corruption of many different types of wildlife, such as this fiery bird species from a molten world.

name: Sapphire Skyblazer
description: These brilliant blue birds burn brighter (and hotter) than their orange cousins, though the origin of both remains a mystery.

name: Vicious Sabertooth
description: The elite Horde forces that use these sabertooth mounts use a battle cry that translates from Thalassian as "pspspspsps".

name: Grand Caravan Mammoth
description: Merchants trust only this thundering, mountainous steed to protect them when venturing down Azeroth's most dangerous trade routes.

name: Brawler's Burly Mushan Beast
description: For years pandaren believed these creatures to be untamable. Just ask the first pandaren to do so, Henshi "Limp Along" Homebrew.

name: Savage Green Battle Turtle
description: Turtle too slow to chase down your foes? Just add cannons. Nothing can outrun a cannon.

name: Kafa Yak
description: It's unclear whether grummles named this yak after its color or purpose.

name: Battle Gargon Silessa
description: Silessa fought valiantly alongside her master in the great incursion by the Light, following the battle her master set her to guard over a vault room of great value.

name: Black War Mammoth
description: Sure-footed and unflappable, these dark-furred mammoths are prized for their steady temperament going into battle.

name: Flarecore Infernal
description: The Legion has conquered thousands of other planets, devising fiendish alterations to their war machines when faced with extreme conditions.

name: Kaldorei Nightsaber
description: The connection between a nightsaber and its hunter or huntress is nearly inseparable.

name: Snapdragon Kelpstalker
description: When a snapdragon bites you, the worry isn't about the bite itself, but the poison that will begin to eat away at the wound.

name: Grimhowl
description: Otherwise known as The Flame Woof, the Fetcher of the Igneous, Molten Core's Best Friend, Forgehound Maximus, the Best Fiery Boy, and "oh no is that an AXE on his face!?"

name: Twilight Drake
description: But the most important rule, the rule you can never forget, no matter how much he cries, no matter how much he begs, never feed him after midnight.

name: Gorespine
description: Nerissa trampled over countless bodies on the back of Gorespine as she rose to prominence as the commander of the Lichsworn forces for the House of Rituals.

name: Harvester's Dredwing
description: The dredwings of the Harvesters fear no mawsworn, and will gleefully sink their teeth into anything that threatens Sinfall.

name: Lightforged Ruinstrider
description: A loyal steed to the Lightforged Draenei.

name: Darkforge Ram
description: A loyal steed to the defenders of Ironforge.

name: Viridian Phase-Hunter
description: Hailing from a species already adept at natural camouflage, the otherworldly energies that transformed Draenor into Outland gave these creatures the ability to shift through space.

name: Swift Spectral Armored Gryphon
description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

name: Darkwarren Hardshell
description: The Darkwarren Hardshell's chitin is sturdy enough to withstand mortar shells and dragon's fire. It will also conveniently consume anything lacking anima, if needed.

name: Gilded Prowler
description: The mighty larion is an apex predator of Bastion, but that does not stop it from enjoying a nice nap in the sunny fields.

name: Vicious Warstalker
description: Trample the Horde to dust while riding a majestic protoform wolf! For the Alliance!

name: Blue Riding Nether Ray
description: Nether Rays are among the most trusted, versatile mounts in all of Outland and beyond.

name: Skeletal Horse
description: Like most undead creatures, it did not choose its fate.

name: Child of Torcali
description: This daughter of the great direhorn loa, Torcali, never lost faith that her keeper would help her grow to her full potential.

name: Vicious Warstalker
description: Trample the Alliance to dust while riding a majestic protoform wolf! For the Horde!

name: Horrid Dredwing
description: Harika the Horrid terrorized the denizens of the Forest Ward, and with her demise her broodlings can now take this horror to denizens farther afield.

name: Soultwisted Deathwalker
description: A howling vortex of tormented souls, ridden only by those who wish to demonstrate their impressive tolerance for pain and suffering.

name: Great Sea Ray
description: The rays of the great sea can travel for many miles in great migratory patterns.

name: Swift Spectral Magnetocraft
description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

name: Vicious War Gorm
description: The gorm love eating the corpses of your enemies, so this seemed like a natural fit.

name: Waste Marauder
description: Larger than most of its kin, this vulture has shown sick and strong beasts alike why they need to fear the skies.

name: Sintouched Deathwalker
description: Forged from the sins of countless diabolical dungeon denizens. Only those with the skills to overcome them may hold its reins.

name: Slime Serpent
description: This mysterious creature lurks beneath the slime pools of Plaguefall. No one knows where it came from.

name: Imperial Quilen
description: Favorite pets of the ancient Mogu princes, Quilen make loyal and fearless companions and mounts.

name: Bruce
description: BRUCE!

name: Phalynx of Humility
description: The phalynx does not fetch, though it is not known why this is.

name: Lucid Nightmare
description: When riding this mount, your thoughts often wander to far-off places.

name: Stormsong Coastwatcher
description: Tasked with keeping watch on the seas for approaching dangers, the Stormsong Coastwatchers fly constant patrols.

name: Hogrus, Swine of Good Fortune
description: Hogrus was first seen by Emperor Shaohao on the third day of his meditation, and is considered by the Pandaren to be a sign of good fortune to come to those who take action.

name: Spectral Steed
description: Dark spirits flee before the radiance of its presence.

name: Sarge's Tale
description: Hold on a sec, Sarge isn't that large, someone must have spun a tall tale in the Hearthstone Tavern...

name: White Polar Bear
description: The frost vrykul believe that wearing a necklace of polar bear claws will grant them otherworldly strength.

name: Blue Qiraji Battle Tank
description: This (relatively) domesticated silithid is at home only in the desert sands of Ahn'Qiraj.

name: Endmire Flyer
description: Attracted through portals through which little is known these flying devourers have found a home in the Endmire of Revendreth feeding on the latent anima.

name: Rampaging Mauler
description: One would think controlling a rampaging mount would be difficult, but if you can learn to control the direction of the rampage it can be quite useful.

name: Nether Drake
description: The moods of these tempestuous mounts are known to shift as unpredictably and as violently as their physical forms.

name: Vulpine Familiar
description: A fiercely intelligent and curious species, these fox-like creatures have travelled the Great Dark Beyond and found their way to Azeroth. Drawn to Azeroth's champions, they seek adventure and companionship.

name: Wastewander Skyterror
description: Doubting a Wastewander Skyterror's capabilities is a quick way to find yourself missing a limb.

name: Merciless Nether Drake
description: The most aggressive nether drakes were awarded those heroes who showed significant prowess and commitment in the gladiatorial arena.

name: Lurid Bloodtusk
description: Only bloodtusks that survive the Contest of Conquest are deemed worthy enough to become a mount of the Undying Army.

name: Cartel Master's Gearglider
description: Only the richest cartel leaders are able to afford the metals required to craft the Cartel Master's Gearglider.

name: Vicious War Gorm
description: The gorm love eating the corpses of your enemies, so this seemed like a natural fit.

name: Bloodgorged Hunter
description: If he wasn't so full, you wouldn't have caught him.

name: Court Sinrunner
description: Sinrunners were once the steeds of dark souls, carried in the wake of either their sins or their masters' sins to Revendreth. While some chose to run free, many continue to serve darkness in death as they did in life.

name: Ashes of Al'ar
description: Al'ar was the beloved pet of Kael'thas Sunstrider, who often boasted that death would never claim it. Perhaps he was right.

name: Spotted Frostsaber
description: This hearty mount's ferocious appetite earned it the nickname "Dragon Belly" in the night elf language.

name: Ghastly Charger
description: Not all of Medivh's victims are gone for good.

name: Grand Ice Mammoth
description: At home on the narrow, icy trails of the Storm Peaks, these mammoths are the only mounts the ice giants trust to carry large loads and multiple riders.

name: Enchanted Fey Dragon
description: This majestic creature is Brightwing's older brother. He affirms that she was, in fact, adopted.

name: Magmashell
description: Who's a good little new-forged snail made entirely of elemental lava? You are! Yes, you!

name: Swift Burgundy Wolf
description: The wolves of the Horde are befriended, not domesticated.

name: Arboreal Gulper
description: The wood and foliage growing atop this toad is a natural part of its body, helping it siphon anima from the air to nourish itself.

name: Trained Rocktusk
description: Thoroughly trained in how to snort, trot, and stomp on the faces of its enemies.

name: Auspicious Arborwyrm
description: Sprouting to life only once every sixty years, this living wooden dragon combines the patience of a tree and the grace of a dragon in flight.

name: Wandering Ancient
description: A staunch defender of the forests of Azeroth, the ancients are also known for their glorious canopies of leaves, which change color with the seasons.

name: Black Skeletal Horse
description: The Forsaken believe that without a purpose, even beasts of burden suffer in undeath.

name: Iskaara Trader's Ottuk
description: There are no guarantees when you purchase an ottuk from Tattukiaka. At least they're cute.

name: Divine Kiss of Ohn'ahra
description: ...as though welcomed by the wind itself.

name: Mosshide Riverwallow
description: Aggressive and territorial, the mosshide is known for hiding in river-shore scrub and ambushing unwary passersby.

name: Hand of Bahmethra
description: The most wicked and cruel of her kin, Bahmethra endured the full measure of the Banished One's punishments before her fall.

name: Uncorrupted Voidwing
description: This spawn of Vexiona, cleansed by Wrathion, comes from a flight with a fractured past and uncertain future.

name: Scarlet Pterrordax
description: This pterrordax was so eager to take to the skies that its handler couldn't finish training it.

name: Battle-Bound Warhound
description: Warhounds find comfort in conflict, and the Contest of Conquest is the perfect place to find these beasts honing their abilities.

name: Silver Riding Talbuk
description: The orcs once hunted these graceful herd animals as part of the om'riggor rite of passage ceremony.

name: Ratstallion
description: Years of chain-chugging potions in Dalaran's sewer system have allowed him to grow large, agile, and shadow resistant.

name: Turquoise Raptor
description: Bred from the fiercest stock anywhere and guaranteed not to bite (much).

name: Wriggling Parasite
description: It's so wiggly! Just looking at it move is chaotic and unnerving.

name: Sea Turtle
description: Often caught by fishermen at a young age, these mounts are much more comfortable in the water than they are on land.

name: Darkspear Raptor
description: This raptor breed was originally cultivated by the Drakkari, but has since been adopted by the Darkspear tribe in Northrend.

name: Elusive Quickhoof
description: The kind nature of alpacas makes them perfect as companions for the intrepid adventurer.

name: Wrathful Gladiator's Frost Wyrm
description: Many believe that during their early lives, these wyrms were forced to fight their own kind for the amusement of others. Perhaps that is why they possess a particularly combative temperament.

name: Exarch's Elekk
description: Draenei exarchs have long marched into war atop these imposing mounts, bred for their razor-sharp tusks.

name: Risen Mare
description: Something terrible happened in the lost town of Havenswood.

name: Swift Albino Raptor
description: The Witherbark warrior Beastrider Kama once cut bloody swathes of terror across the Arathi Highlands astride such a monster.

name: Vicious War Spider
description: When being a bellowing member of the Horde doesn't strike the right amount of fear into your opponent, add a giant spider.

name: Telix the Stormhorn
description: Once a simple beetle of the Forbidden Reach, Telix became infused with storm magic when Raszageth was unleashed. With its newly heightened senses, Telix roams the Dragon Isles alongside the Dragonscale Expedition--and you!

name: Zereth Overseer
description: Enigmatic and aloof, this construct of the First Ones flies on a graceful stream of perfect geometric understanding.

name: Vicious Kaldorei Warsaber
description: The blades adorning this mount's armor are designed to both inspire fear and pre-slice meals for the warsaber.

name: Royal Swarmer
description: These drones will swarm anyone who dares approach their queen uninvited.

name: Phalynx of Purity
description: Little is known about the origination of phalynx technology, the machinations of which are taught more akin to religion than engineering.

name: Sinful Gladiator's Soul Eater
description: This mount shows a proclivity for snacking upon the souls cast out of Revendreth.

name: War-Bred Tauralus
description: The soldiers of Maldraxxus protect the Shadowlands, and require a mount that is both capable and calm when faced with overwhelming odds.

name: Grove Defiler
description: The Grove Wardens of the Emerald Dream were some of the first to fall to the corrupting influence of the Nightmare.

name: Vengeful Nether Drake
description: The most aggressive nether drakes were awarded those heroes who showed significant prowess and commitment in the gladiatorial arena.

name: Craghorn Chasm-Leaper
description: These mighty leapers have adapted to island life by learning to catch seagulls swooping through crags and fissures.

name: Wakener's Runestag
description: Runestags enjoy lying near wildseeds. The Wakeners believe they can hear the sleepers' dreams. These runestags display a range of emotions in their vigil, signaling the dreams or nightmares of the spirits within.

name: Emerald Pandaren Phoenix
description: The colors of this rare phoenix's plumage are said to bring great fortune.

name: Black Proto-Drake
description: Bred specifically to honor those heroes who showed exceptional resilience and fortitude facing the dangers in Northrend.

name: Darkspore Mana Ray
description: Some of the natural wildlife of Argus, like the mana ray, has survived and adapted to life on the shattered world.

name: Exodar Elekk
description: Exodar Elekk are elekk which have been anointed by O'ros, the Naaru who journeyed from Draenor to Azeroth with Velen and his followers.

name: Silverwind Larion
description: This gift of the silvery winds is only bestowed upon those that search high and low for the wisdom of Bastion.

name: Emerald Raptor
description: Bred from the fiercest stock anywhere and guaranteed not to bite (much).

name: Eternal Phalynx of Humility
description: When an armored phalynx is forged, stewards clap their hammers together in reverence of the skill required in its creation.

name: Vicious Sabertooth
description: The elite Alliance forces that use these sabertooth mounts use a battle cry that translates from Darnassian as "here kitty kitty".

name: Noble Bruffalon
description: It is a great honor to be trusted with one of the Maruuk's loyal hunting companions. This Bruffalon is reliable and steadfast through any hardship.

name: Enchanted Shadeleaf Runestag
description: An shadeleaf runestag is capable of goring creatures as powerful as a gorm matriarch in defense of its herd. The Wild Hunt ride these mounts into dangerous corners of the Shadowlands, when their domain must be defended from those who would threaten the wilds.

name: Beryl Shardhide
description: These shardhides find it easy to hide in the underbrush, and it is rare to find one that is tamed.

name: Obsidian Krolusk
description: This krolusk is marked with proof of surviving scores of trials and hardships.

name: Winding Slitherdrake
description: These drakes feel at home in the depths of the earth and the far reaches of the sky.

name: Goblin Turbo-Trike
description: The turbo trike's tri-wheel design adds superior stability and a smaller turn radius over its two wheeled cousins.

name: Flying Carpet
description: Hop aboard this flying carpet to see the shining, shimmering, and splendid world of Azeroth, wonder by wonder.

name: Cataloged Shalewing
description: The first instance of a flaming shalewing ever discovered. Nine out of ten researchers agree: it's hot!

name: Headless Horseman's Mount
description: Be it into the flood, or into the fire, this one will go where you require.

name: Island Thunderscale
description: One of the larger native dragon species on Azeroth, this subspecies subsists almost entirely on fish. And fishermen.

name: Garn Nighthowl
description: The garn are the most fierce predators on Draenor, and always hunt in packs.

name: Pond Nettle
description: This miraculous aquatic species can survive in the harshest environments, perhaps even the void of space.

name: Colossal Umbrahide Mawrat
description: This disturbingly large Mawrat is an anomaly amongst its species. These Colossal Mawrats lurk only in the most distant and darkest reaches of Torghast.

name: Swift Moonsaber
description: Many night elves revere these proud mounts because their shimmering coats symbolize the goddess of the moon, Elune.

name: Acherus Deathcharger
description: Some horses merely adopt the dark. This horse was born in it, molded by it.

name: Umber Nightsaber
description: Nightsabers are an integral part of the Kaldorei's army, serving as both mount and assault weapon in one.

name: Mystic Runesaber
description: Infused with arcane power, the Mystic Runesaber has long been hidden by chaotic nether energies. Recently they have emerged from the shadows in search of ley lines to sate their thirst for magic.

name: Geosynchronous World Spinner
description: This rocket was originally designed to speed up the rotation of the world making for shorter nights.  Gnomes with insomnia can have lofty goals.

name: Traveler's Tundra Mammoth
description: Ancient manuscripts depict merchants traveling across the frozen tundra with these colossal beasts, leading scholars to believe they are the first domesticated mounts.

name: Sunwarmed Furline
description: The presence of the giant felines heralds the beginning of the end for the birds of Azeroth.

name: Vicious War Ram
description: Until it head-butts you below the belt, it has not truly accepted you as its rider.

name: Battlelord's Bloodthirsty War Wyrm
description: Also responds to "Mister Bitey."

name: Colossal Ebonclaw Mawrat
description: This vicious and cunning creature has grown to its astonishing size by not only feasting upon the weakened souls in the Jailer's Tower, but also vulnerable Mawsworn.

name: Brewfest Riding Kodo
description: You can't remember exactly how you got this mount. Then again, you can't remember much of anything that happens at Brewfest.

name: Gleaming Moonbeast
description: Armored in glistening silver, these devoted mounts are said to be a blessing from Elune herself.

name: Kul Tiran Charger
description: The Kul Tiran military prides itself on mastery of both sea, through a vast navy, and land, with armed cavalry.

name: Sandy Shalewing
description: The patterns on the wings of that creature resemble sand flowing through an hourglass. One could gaze upon them for ages...

name: Mechacycle Model W
description: The rapid technological evolution of the descendants of Mimiron began with the introduction of a new gear, leading to such wonders as the tragically under-produced Model W.

name: Grey Riding Camel
description: Fennimore Quigley is credited with milking the first camel and breaking the record for "longest unintentional flight," all in the same afternoon.

name: Golden Cloud Serpent
description: Golden Cloud Serpents are a treasure to be enjoyed by all who visit the continent of Pandaria.

name: Skullripper
description: She's a clever girl.

name: Felsteel Annihilator
description: Forged deep within Hellfire Citadel by a mad blacksmith, the Felsteel Annihilator combines the metalworking knowledge of the Iron Horde with the chaotic fel energies of the Burning Legion into an unholy union of steel and flame.

name: Loyal Magmammoth
description: Liberated from the Qalashi and harnessed by your ingenuity (and your harness), this magmammoth is ready to lava stomp wherever you want to go.

name: Vicious War Mechanostrider
description: Equipped with head-mounted Critter Destroyer 9000.

name: Duskwing Ohuna
description: If you look to the night sky and see the clouds whisk by don't panic. It may just be the illusive Duskwing Ohuna.

name: Renewed Proto-Drake
description: As the isles awaken, these proto-drakes answer the call to soar the skies alongside mortals.

name: Vicious War Bear
description: Almost twice as vicious as its Horde counterpart.

name: Black War Mammoth
description: Normally placid beasts, these intelligent animals form a strong bond with their riders, making them loyal and fearless in battle.

name: Abyss Worm
description: The shadows that trail off of its scales are otherworldly, is this creature from the depths of Azeroth's oceans?

name: Starcursed Voidstrider
description: This shadow-infused strider embodies the elves' commitment to harness the power of the Void in the name of the Alliance.

name: Xiwyllag ATV
description: It was said that this invention was modeled after the likeness of a very wealthy goblin. Although others don't really see the resemblance.

name: Swift Spectral Rylak
description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

name: Crimson Deathcharger
description: Stabled in the Icecrown Citadel to serve the Lich King's most favored minions.

name: Bound Blizzard
description: A flurrious, fridgid friend, frost-flecked for frozen fun.

name: Marrowfang
description: Marrowfang, Bonefang's progeny, was respected by Amarth the Harvester for her insatiable appetite, even if it disrupted any experiments that the sadistic commander wanted to run.

name: Elusive Emerald Hawkstrider
description: Unseen for many years, this brightly hued hawkstrider emerged from hiding to help defend the Ghostlands from the Scourge. Its prowess shines as brilliantly as its feathers.

name: Phosphorescent Stone Drake
description: The Stonemother has shown little concern for the rebellious Aeonaxx, even allowing his spawn to be taken from her realm.

name: Smoky Direwolf
description: Believed to reside mostly in the north. Hates weddings.

name: Netherlord's Brimstone Wrathsteed
description: The smell isn't particularly pleasant, and it REALLY stays with you.

name: Vicious White Bonesteed
description: There are few other ways to ride in to battle that feature as many spikes and bones.

name: Magic Rooster
description: Magic in the hands of a genius can do wonderful, miraculous things. Magic in the hands of an idiot can make a giant rooster.

name: Striped Nightsaber
description: Considered one of Azeroth's perfect predators, these agile beasts can sprint through dense forests without making a sound.

name: Spirit of Eche'ro
description: The spirit of Huln Highmountain's pet moose.

name: Heart of the Aspects
description: You are Azeroth's true guardians and the future of this world is in your hands, for the dawning of the age of mortals has begun. - Alexstrasza

name: Minion of Grumpus
description: No one quite knows when the legend of Grumpus began in Draenor, but his toys are just the worst.

name: Tamed Skitterfly
description: It didn't take long for Granpap Whiskers to tame the skitterflies around the Dragonscale Basecamp and set them to helping move Expedition personnel and cargo.

name: Mossy Mammoth
description: Preserved for thousands of years in stone, bronze magic has nearly aged this mammoth back into a fossil.

name: Soaring Skyterror
description: The extra-light equipment on this chromatic rylak allows it to swoop and glide through the clouds easily, free from the bounds of the land below.

name: Gold-Toed Albatross
description: Soaring from a distant timeway, this never-before-seen avian variant was born in a world of order.

name: Ancient Frostsaber
description: The lack of spots or stripes marks this beast as a descendant of the most ancient frostsaber line.

name: Illidari Felstalker
description: The Illidari have broken some lesser demons for use against their Legion masters.

name: Vibrant Mana Ray
description: Some of the natural wildlife of Argus, like the mana ray, has survived and adapted to life on the shattered world.

name: Taivan
description: You don't have to be what the world expects you to be. Be who Taivan knows you *can* be.

name: Silky Shimmermoth
description: The moths of Ardenweald play a vital role in the ecosystem, carrying spores, anima, and pollen from one part of the forest to the other, providing nourishment and variation to the denizens living below.

name: Windborne Velocidrake
description: The long talons of the velocidrake give it an edge on the plains.

name: Pearlescent Goblin Wave Shredder
description: Surf the shores of Stranglethorn in style!

name: Kor'kron Annihilator
description: Vicious in battle and surprisingly loyal, this battle scorpion serves only those who show true commitment to a powerful guild.

name: Brown Skeletal Horse
description: The Forsaken believe that without a purpose, even beasts of burden suffer in undeath.

name: Duskflutter Ardenmoth
description: These ardenmoths prefer the dark and damp forests of northwest Ardenweald, where fungal colonies are perpetually blooming.

name: Rocket Shredder 9001
description: The salesgoblin always tells people about the RS-9001's huge variety of attachments, but somehow neglects to mention that you never get to pick the attachments it'll have when you mount up.

name: Soaring Razorwing
description: The hide of the razorwing is light, allowing it to fly, but also quite tough, allowing them to survive passage into the Maw.

name: Felstorm Dragon
description: The Burning Legion defeated dragons in a distant timeway. These foul fel wyrms chose corruption and servitude over destruction.

name: Forged Spiteflyer
description: There's nothing that can make you feel as alive quite like riding through the realm of Death while atop a being that hates you.

name: Crimson Primal Direhorn
description: Leave it to the blood elves to pick the red one.

name: Scrapforged Mechaspider
description: You built this yourself, you should be proud, even though it's smoky, sparky, and loud.

name: Dark Iron Core Hound
description: You don't get dogs hotter than this.

name: Highland Drake
description: The drakes of Azure Span follow a strict personal code of honor as they explore the isles anew.

name: Steelbound Devourer
description: Only the sturdiest-forged chains can restrain this beast.

name: Lord of the Corpseflies
description: To be the Lord of the Corpseflies, you've got to lay a LOT of eggs.

name: Swift White Ram
description: The Barak Tor'ol ram's thick bony skull and massive horns make it the ideal mount for charging through groups of armored enemies.

name: Vitreous Stone Drake
description: Those would be perfect in a pendant, and that would make a fantastic ring. Let me know if this thing sheds or molts or whatever. -Kalinda

name: Clutch of Ji-Kun
description: Although Ji-Kun feasted on the failed creations of mogu flesh-shapers, her progeny is willing to eat more pedestrian carcasses.

name: White Mechanostrider Mod B
description: Forced to recall the model after numerous complaints of an "uncontrollable throttle", Gnomish engineers now refer to a proto-type blunder as a "model B".

name: Thundering Cobalt Cloud Serpent
description: This is a descendant of the irascible Nalak. Lightning erupts from its scales and arcs over the saddle. Dare you sit?

name: Jigglesworth Sr.
description: It's unclear how the saddle stays atop this formerly feline friend, but somehow the House of Plagues made it work. Science.

name: Shadowblade's Crimson Omen
description: The blood of your enemies won't even show up, blends right in.

name: Huntmaster's Dire Wolfhawk
description: If asked to fetch, will most likely bring you back the head of a small mammal or humanoid.

name: Curious Crystalsniffer
description: Most vombata enjoy tunneling through the ground, but these sniffers seem to have an unerring ability to locate crystals buried deep underground and will congregate around large deposits.

name: Liberated Slyvern
description: It's difficult to tell because it's far too angry, but this slyvern is actually glad it's not owned by gnolls anymore.

name: Shadeleaf Runestag
description: The shadeleaf runestag are bred for their ferocity as well as their beauty by the Wild Hunt. They feel no fear charging into the den of any predator.

name: Ascendant Skyrazor
description: Intended for the most devoted of the Sureki elite, these skyrazors were favored by Queen Ansurek for both their cunning and brutality.

name: Highlord's Vigilant Charger
description: His blank horse stare is "vigilance," actually.

name: Obsidian Vorquin
description: Respected for their resilience in battle, even against dragonfire, these noble beasts are the prized mounts of the dracthyr cavalry.

name: Genesis Crawler
description: The Enlightened who have observed tarachnids believe that this variety may be some of the first beings to ever walk the land of Zereth Mortis.

name: Savage Blue Battle Turtle
description: Don't feel blue chasing your foes, you've got cannons. Nothing can outrun a cannon.

name: Prideful Gladiator's Cloud Serpent
description: These brilliantly colored cloud serpents have scales that range from gold to pink. Or we could call it coral.

name: Majestic Armored Vorquin
description: Trained using ancient dracthyr methods, these armored vorquin are the pinnacle of tactical mounted ground warfare.

name: Bestowed Ohuna Spotter
description: A gift from the Ohn'ir, these ohuna are invaluable companions when scouting new horizons for the Dragonscale Expedition.

name: Tarachnid Creeper
description: These tarachnids make their home in the darkest corners of Zereth Mortis, coming out only to hunt (or, sometimes, carry a rider around).

name: Wastewarped Deathwalker
description: Raw swirling energy bound together into a cohesive form, it will only bend to the will of those strong enough to bind it.

name: Darkened Vombata
description: The schematic to synthesize these darkened vombata seem to have appeared as a reaction to the Mawsworn invasion. The resulting vombata look different--darker, much like the invaders--but behave normally.

name: Prestigious Forest Courser
description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

name: Stormtouched Bruffalon
description: Even from within her prison, Raszageth's primal scorn brought the mightiest beasts to heel.

name: Wondrous Wavewhisker
description: They say one of these magical fish is born when a fisherfolk dreams of the one that got away... and grows bigger with each retelling of the tale.

name: Guardian Vorquin
description: Trained using ancient dracthyr methods, these armored vorquin are the pinnacle of tactical mounted ground warfare.

name: Depthstalker
description: Poached from Zereth Mortis, a few of these jellyfish were lost when the poachers' ship sank. They found a new home in the Great Sea's depths.

name: Black Nightsaber
description: Considered one of Azeroth's perfect predators, these agile beasts can sprint through dense forests without making a sound.

name: Pandaren Kite
description: This token of honor is a gift from the Lorewalkers of Pandaria. Flying manual seemingly not included, however.

name: Drake of the North Wind
description: They sicken of the calm who know the storm.

name: Brinedeep Bottom-Feeder
description: These elusive fish prefer to skulk in the deepest reaches of the Great Sea, searching the darkness for food.

name: Tazavesh Gearglider
description: Brokers of all types use these gliders to travel around Tazavesh and similar nearby outposts, and carry their goods as well.

name: Tangled Dreamweaver
description: The last of the sleepers are finally awakening, bringing the dreams of the dragons back to the lands.

name: Hailstorm Armoredon
description: Born in the middle of an ice storm, this armoredon prefers its meals partially frozen.

name: Windborne Velocidrake
description: The long talons of the velocidrake give it an edge on the plains.

name: Buzz
description: Buzz buzz buzz, buzz buzz! Buzz buzz buzz buzz buzz. Buzz buzz buzz, buzz buzz buzz.

name: Armadillo Roller
description: The technologies and creatures of the deep will help us traverse these unknown areas.

name: Val'sharah Hippogryph
description: These majestic hippogryphs are as close to a being of the Emerald Dream as any resident of Azeroth can be, and do not bond with a rider easily.

name: Forsworn Aquilon
description: Originally produced by the Forsworn with stolen blueprints, these powerful centurion are now earning a reputation across the Shadowlands.

name: Bronze Vorquin
description: Respected for their resilience in battle, even against dragonfire, these noble beasts are the prized mounts of the dracthyr cavalry.

name: Violet Netherwing Drake
description: After promising to fly you to the ends of Outland, the netherwing drake was eventually drawn to the blue skies of Azeroth as well.

name: Mastercraft Gravewing
description: Handcrafted by the Stonewright herself, this mastefully crafted stoneborn is entrusted only to those she deems worthy.

name: Raging Magmammoth
description: Most lava flows. This lava charges.

name: Felcrystal Scorpion
description: The results of a fel infusion experiment with one of Skorpyron's offspring.

name: Wen Lo, the River's Edge
description: The rivers of Pandaria, like Wen Lo, are unpredictable in nature. They may remain calm, bringing water to the crops, or flood, bringing ruin. Wen Lo reminds us that we must adapt to the challenges of life.

name: Brown War Ottuk
description: The tuskarr of Iskaara are loathe to war against anyone, but many tuskarr and their allies have nonetheless taken up the spear with a war ottuk beside them.

name: Garnet Razorwing
description: Korthia was once known for its bright red flowers. Several species were known for consuming or rolling in them, and taking on bright red coloration as a result.

name: Swift Armored Vorquin
description: Trained using ancient dracthyr methods, these armored vorquin are the pinnacle of tactical mounted ground warfare.

name: Carcinized Zerethsteed
description: The few of these mysterious creatures that remain appear to be impossibly old, almost timeless. Perhaps they were created by the First Ones, because no schematic to synthesize these has yet been discovered.

name: Armored Vorquin Leystrider
description: Trained using ancient dracthyr methods, these armored vorquin are the pinnacle of tactical mounted ground warfare.

name: Bestowed Thunderspine Packleader
description: A gift from Merithra, who blessed these thunderspines to ensure that no matter where the Maruuk clans roam, they will always be under the green dragonflight's protection.

name: Prestigious Bronze Courser
description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

name: Ineffable Skitterer
description: These tarachnids move with a purpose unknown to others, answering only to a higher calling. Whatever that may be, it appears to include routine assistance to mortals who need a ride. For now.

name: Crimson Gladiator's Drake
description: Forged in the fires of conquest, and armored to the teeth.

name: Sentinel War Wolf
description: Captured in a Sentinel raid, the loyalty of the wolf favors the strongest.

name: Adorned Vombata
description: Red-colored vombata are considered lucky by the Enlightened. It was a red vombata that was present when they first arrived in Zereth Mortis.

name: Keg Leg's Radiant Crocolisk
description: The pirate captain later known as Keg Leg knew the risks when he rode a hungry crocolisk into battle.

name: Amani War Bear
description: Only the swiftest heroes venturing into the troll temple of Zul'Aman were able to subdue these rare battle mounts.

name: Dusklight Razorwing
description: Razorwings can be seen throughout Korthia, making their nests on high hills and in trees.

name: Vicious War Croaker
description: These creatures are so enthusiastic when charging into battle that they will croak out something that sounds very much like "FOR THE ALLIANCE!"

name: Gooey Snailemental
description: Formed from the leftover elemental energies of the Primal Storms, this magical mollusk is faster than it appears.

name: Demonic Gladiator's Storm Dragon
description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

name: Mammyth
description: In the Dream, sometimes the myth is more real than its basis.

name: Albino Drake
description: Even the Draconic Native Association tests proved inconclusive in determining if the albino drake is related to a known dragonflight. -Breanni

name: Fierce Razorwing
description: Razorwings generally stay away from other Korthian species, but with time and patience, they can be tamed as well.

name: Phalynx of Courage
description: A phalynx is considered both a worthy companion and a lithe opponent to test one's reflexes against.

name: Bronzewing Vespoid
description: Bronzewing vespoids are the result of attempting to synthesize a vespoid queen with no other members of a new hive. While no mortal has yet discovered how to synthesize a hive, the bronzewings are reliable mounts just as they are.

name: Ascendant's Aquilon
description: The aquilon can rapidly transport aspirants, stewards, and even ascended to a location. Hey, sometimes your wings get tired.

name: Armored Snowy Gryphon
description: The nice thing is that when they attack, blood almost never stains their feathers. -Mei Francis

name: Bronze Helicid
description: Some helicids of Zereth Mortis have strangely metallic shells. The ones who do are generally a bronze color, indistinct from the metal any novice miner could work, save that this creature's construction far surpasses the skill of any novice.

name: Bestowed Ottuk Vanguard
description: A gift from Brena, the Iskaara sent their most loyal (and adorable) companions to watch over Kalecgos and his reuinited family in Valdrakken

name: Brewfest Ram
description: Brewers retired this mount from active advertising service after complaints that the beasts were "too temperamental" to control in major cities.

name: Elysian Aquilon
description: With anima once again flowing to the Eternal Forge in Bastion, the plans for the aquilon centurion could be crafted once more.

name: Valiance
description: Most undead steeds have their riders chosen for them. Valiance, on the other hand, chooses its own rider.

name: Swift Spectral Tiger
description: Historians claim that these incorporeal beasts were created when Draenor exploded, unleashing energies that warped the world's flora and fauna.

name: Tarecgosa's Visage
description: "Farewell, Tarecgosa. A dear sister, hero, student, and teacher. Though blood does not bind us, you will always be family. May your soul find its place soaring among the stars."

name: Regal Corpsefly
description: Only the forces of Maldraxxus would call a corpsefly "regal."

name: Mawdapted Raptora
description: Since the Jailer's incursion, new raptora have been synthesized by Zereth Mortis that are capable of resisting the corrupting influence of the Maw.

name: Corridor Creeper
description: The loyal hounds of the Jailer creep along the corridors in search of the scent of souls.

name: Zovaal's Soul Eater
description: "Was I a good boy?" the soul asked Zovaal. "No. I'm told you were the worst."

name: Darkmaul
description: An older shardhide, Darkmaul was relatively tame and friendly around Korthians. He was thought lost to the calamity.

name: Hand of Reshkigaal
description: Reshkigaal bided her time as her kin each tried their hand at usurping the Banished One. She sought to attack when he was distracted, but the Jailer's spies had been tracking her. With their warning and aid, the Jailer prevailed.

name: Sinfall Gravewing
description: With anima once again flowing in Sinfall, the Stonewright has been able to infuse these Stoneborn, making them valuable allies in the battles to come.

name: Deathrunner
description: These wild cervids are only truly at peace when running through--or between--the lands of Death.

name: Coralscale Salamanther
description: As Raszageth's storms abated, this aquatic breed of salamanther was among the many wonders to settle among the shores in their wake.

name: Cliffside Wylderdrake
description: Often roosting along the steep cliff faces of Thaldraszus, they're swift to the skies in times of danger.
