name: Smoldering Cinderbee
description: A somewhat surprising choice of mount, the Council of Dornogal assures you riding it is safe. Mostly.

name: Maelie, the Wanderer
description: A curious and inquisitive doe, she doesn't mean to worry her master, she just gets distracted easily. Especially with all of the new things to see on Korthia.

name: Sapphire Vorquin
description: Respected for their resilience in battle, even against dragonfire, these noble beasts are the prized mounts of the dracthyr cavalry.

name: Ivory Hawkstrider
description:
"My winged children fill the skies. Not this one though."

-Aviana

name: Draconic Gladiator's Drake
description: Its wings darken the skies with the shadow of conquest.

name: Chauffeured Mechano-Hog
description: Why drive yourself around when you can hire someone to do it for you?

name: Otterworldly Ottuk Carrier
description: Some ottuks get into the spirit of carrying people around more than others.

name: Palehide Mushan Beast
description: The Palehide Mushan is the tastiest of Mushan beasts, but it hates being reminded of that fact.

name: Soaring Spelltome
description: In the forgotten depths of the Dalaran library, this oversized tome was found flapping madly around the room. Open the pages of this arcane-infused book and hitch a ride to magical adventure.

name: Serenade
description: These beautiful helicids emerge only at night. When they are pleased, their shells hum with a joyful melody.

name: Zenet Hatchling
description: The hardest winds begin with a gust and a flap.

name: Scarlet Helicid
description: This helicid's unusual reddish tint is clearly intentional in its design, but the only other difference between these and other helicids is the unusual lack of any ooze.

name: Unchained Gladiator's Soul Eater
description: This soul eater's gaze unnerves you. Best not meet its eyes for too long.

name: Obsidian Gladiator's Slitherdrake
description: This mischievous drake enjoys flying through geysers and volcanic plumes.

name: Cosmic Gladiator's Soul Eater
description: This soul eater's gaze unnerves you. Best not meet its eyes for too long.

name: Voracious Gorger
description: The devourers are presumed to have their origins in the In-Between, a space between the lands of the Shadowlands that few have explored.

name: Sanctum Gloomcharger
description: Only the Jailer's most powerful lieutenants are gifted these steeds to stalk the halls of the Tower.

name: Amani Battle Bear
description: The Amani trolls decorate these ferocious mounts in magic amulets and ceremonial masks as a way to venerate the bear god Nalorakk.

name: Heartlight Vombata
description: The Enlightened revere all creations of the First Ones, yet for many, the vombata of Zereth Mortis are the most beloved. These creatures are equal parts trusted beast of burden and beloved companion.

name: Spectral Tiger
description: In true goblin fashion, Landro Longshot has put a stranglehold on the distribution of these mysterious incorporeal mounts.

name: Spinemaw Gladechewer
description: Spriggan riders tie bits of anima-less detritus to the end of sticks in front of their gorm mounts to steer. It's... an imperfect art.

name: Shimmering Aurelid
description: Though it was once created to defend the Sepulcher of the First Ones, with its primary function now completed, it now obediently follows your command.

name: Crimson Pandaren Phoenix
description: The plumage of the Crimson Phoenix is said to represent prosperity and happiness.

name: Sundered Zerethsteed
description: Whatever the purpose of these cervids once was, it is long forgotten. Though they are not Dominated, they have been corrupted by the unintended presence of Mawsworn in the sacred realm of Zereth Mortis.

name: Astral Cloud Serpent
description: It is believed that Astral Cloud Serpents possess answers to some of life's greatest mysteries. Pity they can't talk.

name: Daystorm Windsteed
description: It is said that when lightning strikes the sun, a gleaming beast in red armor would emerge from the heavens. The Daystorm Windsteed has never heard of these legends and has been here the entire time.

name: Ash'adar, Harbinger of Dawn
description: Kaldorei legends whisper of a relentless hunter prowling amongst the deepest shadows of Kalimdor, never sleeping. By the light of the sun or the moon, Ash'adar now hunts with you.

name: Crimson Vorquin
description: Respected for their resilience in battle, even against dragonfire, these noble beasts are the prized mounts of the dracthyr cavalry.

name: Soulbound Gloomcharger
description: Ve'nari has many methods of sneaking around the Maw and disrupting the Jailer's plans, including binding his own minions.

name: Amalgam of Rage
description: The fearsome beast ridden by Astaroth himself is now yours to command.

name: Hand of Nilganihmaht
description: Of all the giants who dared defy the Jailer, Nilganihmaht was the most arrogant. For this transgression, the giant's severed hand was hidden within a veil of torments, and the rings that could summon it back were scattered across the Maw.

name: Cryptic Aurelid
description: The Cyphers of the First Ones are beyond any mortal understanding. A curious effect of the language is that, for reasons unknown, some aurelids are drawn to mortals who aspire to unlock its mystery.

name: Ancient Salamanther
description: Due to their preference for dark caves and murky waters, sightings of this unique breed of salamanther are so rare that many researchers thought they had gone extinct.

name: Green Shado-Pan Riding Tiger
description: "When waking a tiger, use a long stick. Better yet, tell your friend to wake the tiger instead." -Pandaren Proverb

name: Crimson Glimmerfur
description: Gilnean legend states this red-and-white fox only crosses the Winter Veil during one season.

name: Polly Roger
description: The scourge of the slightly-northeastern seas, giant parrots like Polly can live for up to 2000 years. What a wonderful curse on your next of kin.

name: Pale Gravewing
description: Gravewings know no fear and are nearly indestructible -- perfect for an assault on the Maw.

name: Wild Hunt Legsplitter
description: Integrated into the depleted forces of the Wild Hunt, the fawn riders quickly found that the gorm's powerful mandibles were perfect for cutting down close enemy ranks.

name: Colossal Wraithbound Mawrat
description: Infused by the energies of tormented souls, these creatures have adopted ghostlike abilities that make them quite elusive.

name: Great Brown Dragon Turtle
description: "Packaged upgrades include; dual-lantern fog lights, emergency brew keg, and genuine Tanji leather seat."  - Turtlemaster Odai

name: Alabaster Stormtalon
description: Chiseled by the stonemasons of Stormwind, this stone gryphon symbolizes the unbending courage of the Alliance.

name: Heavenly Crimson Cloud Serpent
description: Heavenly Crimson Cloud Serpents are considered to be among the noblest of dragons.

name: Vicious War Croaker
description: These creatures are so enthusiastic when charging into battle that they will croak out something that sounds very much like "FOR THE HORDE!"

name: Night Pterrorwing
description: Scholars interpret this creature's awful screeching as "fear me, I am the night!"

name: Thundering August Cloud Serpent
description: From their infancy, Thundering Cloud Serpents are drawn to storms. They have been known to chase lightning through the blackened, roiling clouds, and to bathe in the pouring rain.

name: Astral Emperor's Serpent
description: After the unburdened Emperor Shaohao gave his final breath to protect his people, a golden serpent descended from the heavens to alight the emperor's spirit to the peaks of Kun-Lai Summit.

name: Dread Gladiator's Proto-Drake
description: They say that proto-drakes can smell fear. This iron-bound monster FEEDS off of it.

name: Harbor Gryphon
description: This gryphon was the runt of its pride, left behind when its brethren were sent for training. Today, however, it is ready to prove its worth.

name: Eternal Gladiator's Soul Eater
description: This soul eater's gaze unnerves you. Best not meet its eyes for too long.

name: Flourishing Whimsydrake
description: These playful protectors of the Emerald Dream may be larger than their faerie dragon relatives, but they are no less mischievous.

name: Spawn of Horridon
description: When you see a hurricane coming, you get out of the way. Horridon would fight the hurricane and win.

name: Swift Spectral Drake
description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

name: Unsuccessful Prototype Fleetpod
description: This creature was not designed by the First Ones, but instead by an unknown being attempting to create a very fast runner. Needless to say the attempt failed, because this mount is very slow.

name: Snowy Riding Goat
description: The Kun-Lai Summit mountain goats are known for climbing even the highest peaks in search of kafa beans and salt licks.

name: Amber Primordial Direhorn
description: There is an old Zandalari saying about wild direhorns: "Run!"

name: Heavenly Azure Cloud Serpent
description: Warmth and serenity emanate from this great creature, which glows like the cloudless sky of a summer afternoon.

name: Goldplate Bufonid
description: This armored bufonid is always ready to leap into battle... as long as that battle is really, really close. In a pinch, it can leap multiple times and eventually reach the battle.

name: White Skeletal Warhorse
description: When fallen heroes are raised into undeath, so too are their horses.

name: X-45 Heartbreaker
description: Apothecary Hummel painted this masterpiece bright pink for an unrequited love.

name: Crusader's White Warhorse
description: Awarded to only the most skilled champions from the Trial of the Crusader, these steeds were chosen for Alliance members from Tirion Fordring's own personal stable.

name: Stonevault Mechsuit
description: Metal once ruined, restored to life by scrap and song.

name: Tuskarr Shoreglider
description: The Tuskarr learned long ago that some of the bones of the sea creatures they hunted were light and buoyant, making for effective glider materials.

name: Lunar Dreamstag
description: The moon's pale light is reflected in the pelt of these elusive nocturnal creatures.

name: Rusted Proto-Drake
description: Not as shiny as the other one, but it's still a great find lads. Brann Bronzebeard

name: Hand of Salaranga
description: Salaranga was the most cunning of her kin and hid amongst the Beastwarrens. She struck at the Banished One with a horde of bestial allies. It did not matter.

name: Suntouched Dreamstag
description: The sun's radiant energy nurtures these dreamstags, helping them rapidly reach maturity.

name: Bloodflank Charger
description: Stolen from the Arathi Basin stables, this fire-hearted charger now steeds for the Horde.

name: Highland Drake
description: The drakes of Azure Span follow a strict personal code of honor as they explore the isles anew.

name: Spawn of Galakras
description: This formidable creature's lineage may be traced to Galakras, and yet further to Galakrond, one of the most infamous of all proto-dragons.

name: Drake of the East Wind
description: In Deathwing's mad quest to forge new dragons, he ignored amazing breeds never before seen on Azeroth. -Thrall

name: Black Primal Raptor
description: Speed, cunning, and ferocity are the things trolls and raptors admire about each other.

name: Thundering Onyx Cloud Serpent
description: This ebony cloud serpent is a lightning-wreathed vision of such rarity as to have driven many mortals to madness.

name: Slatestone Ramolith
description: Earthen ranchers talk often of this creature's resilience and how the rain ricochets off of its lustrous coat.

name: Magnificent Flying Carpet
description: Standard features include a sturdy imbued frostweave frame and real iceweb spider silk threading.  Spare head pillow sold separately.

name: Challenger's War Yeti
description: Thankfully they move fast and mostly leave the smell behind them.

name: Black Wolf
description: Can howl loudly enough to be heard for miles.

name: Golden Riding Crane
description: The crane is a symbol of wisdom and nobility, their ability to carry us into the skies is nothing short of miraculous. - Jaluu the Generous

name: Ochre Skeletal Warhorse
description: When fallen heroes are raised into undeath, so too are their horses.

name: Shadowmane Charger
description: Draenei poets have likened this talbuk's coloring to shadows cast by moonlight in an ashen forest.

name: Grievous Gladiator's Cloud Serpent
description: These brilliantly colored cloud serpents have scales that are a mixture of ruby, gold, and nearly violet.

name: Blazing Hippogryph
description: Hippogryphs are highly intelligent, sentient beings; far more than mere "mounts."

name: Sunreaver Dragonhawk
description: The Sunreavers of Dalaran select only the swiftest and most formidable of dragonhawks as their mounts.

name: Armored Bloodwing
description: This monstrous, flesh-eating bat is the undisputed ruler of the night skies.

name: Saltwater Seahorse
description: These giant seahorses are naturally curious, and are often found exploring sunken ship wreckage for shiny things.

name: Great Golden Kodo
description: An alpha member of the herd, this kodo is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through the Southern Barrens.

name: Scrappy Worldsnail
description: For the Worldbreakers, a portable footstool. For you, a hardy mount.

name: Red Primal Raptor
description: Raptors have spread to nearly all of the lands of Azeroth. It is uncertain whether the trolls led them or followed them.

name: Black War Bear
description: This formidable mount is bought with the blood of Alliance leaders, but you would have killed them for free.

name: Heavenly Golden Cloud Serpent
description: Warmth and hope emanate from this great creature, which glows like a sunrise over the mountains.

name: Igneous Shalewing
description: You'd be forgiven for mistaking this creature for a flying volcanic rock. Because to some extent, it is.

name: Azure Riding Crane
description: The majestic crane is a treasured friend of the pandaren.

name: Witherhide Cliffstomper
description: Tiny notches cover the hooves of this variation of clefthoof, allowing it to safely scale mountainous regions in search of food.

name: Invincible
description: The famous steed of Arthas Menethil, who serves its master in life and in death.  Riding him is truly a feat of strength.

name: Creeping Carpet
description: Can't fly, but can creep very quickly.

name: Bloodfang Widow
description: Its long, serrated limbs drip with the blood of its enemies and/or mate.

name: Golden Primal Direhorn
description: Sharp at both ends and crafty in the middle. Leave it to the trolls to think this was a good idea.

name: Lizi, Thunderspine Tramper
description: Nothing will stop Lizi from her mission to eat all the world's fruit.

name: Magic Rooster
description: Magic in the hands of a genius can do wonderful, miraculous things. Magic in the hands of an idiot can make a giant rooster.

name: Kor'kron Warsaber
description: Finding a litter of nightsaber kittens, a squad of Kor'kron Outriders trained them into a formidable pack of deadly mounts.

name: Shadowhide Pearltusk
description: Some legends say the draenei first befriended the elekk after one of the beasts saved an injured scout from a pack of vicious podlings.

name: Slayer's Felbroken Shrieker
description: You broke it, you bought it.

name: Argent Charger
description: Trained to accept only champions of the Light as a rider.

name: Swift Frostwolf
description: Amidst the cold heights of Frostfire, the frostwolves hunt anything they can catch. The fastest among them eat well.

name: Illidari Doomhawk
description: Once a year, a rift in time appears, and strange things occur. The Illidari scouts and Doomwalker were quite surprised to find themselves in Tanaris.

name: Cobalt Shalewing
description: Brood of Karoktra, raised in the underlight of Zaralek Cavern.

name: Goblin Trike
description: A compilation of nuts, bolts, gears, and treated wood paneling make for an unusually smooth ride.

name: Smoldering Ember Wyrm
description: Arcanagos sought to turn Medivh away from experiments into the arcane, but the influence of Sargeras had corrupted the wizard too deeply, and the great dragon paid for the transgression with eternal, burning agony.

name: Blue Dragonhawk
description: Dragonhawks are among the deadliest known predators. They are able to spot prey from great distances, rush in, and rend with both talon and beak.

name: Swift Red Hawkstrider
description: What do you mean is it dyed? Oh, the bird. We did touch up the red just a little. -Trellis Morningsun

name: Snowfeather Hunter
description: Capable of hiding in a fog bank until prey approaches, then slicing them open with one claw-raised jump.

name: Magic Rooster
description: Magic in the hands of a genius can do wonderful, miraculous things. Magic in the hands of an idiot can make a giant rooster.

name: Vashj'ir Seahorse
description: Stubborn until broken, these underwater mounts provide the swiftest means of travel around the depths of Vashj'ir.

name: Core Hound
description: Molten to the core!

name: Mottled Meadowstomper
description: The elekk's long trunk allows it to sniff out sources of food, avoid danger, and steal snacks from your bags when you're not looking.

name: Charming Courier
description: Neither snow nor rain nor heat nor gloom of night stays these charming couriers from the swift completion of their appointed rounds.

name: Armored Blue Dragonhawk
description: After you amassed a massive menagerie of 200 mounts, the animal authorities of the Alliance sent you a means to keep them in line (and out of their hair).

name: Ferocious Jawcrawler
description: This particularly large jawcrawler is the perfect size to make a mount... just keep your hands and feet clear of its mouth.

name: Cyan Glowmite
description: Glowmites are well-known in the Ringing Deeps for making surprisingly sturdy mounts. This specimen produces a soft cyan glow that kobolds find especially relaxing.

name: Avenging Felcrusher
description: After Alleria and Turalyon explained the usefulness of the Draenei's long-time companion animal, the Army of the Light brought several into the fold for training.

name: Viridian Sharptalon
description: Adept at blending into dense, magical forests, such as one may find around the Broken Isles.

name: Fallen Charger
description: The charger's screams echo across the Maw as it continues a never-ending ride across the land, forever looking for escape from the endless torments it has been forced to endure.

name: Prestigious War Steed
description: Armored to withstand collisions in battle.

name: Sunreaver Hawkstrider
description: I demand speed, grace and discipline on the battlefield. This one will serve nicely. -Eressea Dawnsinger

name: Verdant Armoredon
description: The gnarled horns of this armoredon are far stronger than bone.

name: Traveler's Tundra Mammoth
description: Riders and merchants alike trust only this strong and steadfast mammoth to carry them safely across the frigid tundra.

name: Huntmaster's Fierce Wolfhawk
description: A jumble of talons and claws that can fly and swim. No one is safe.

name: Vicious War Elekk
description: A favorite of warriors of the Exodar.

name: Deathlord's Vilebrood Vanquisher
description: A powerful red dragon raised in undeath by its own life energies, a true mockery of life.

name: Icebound Frostbrood Vanquisher
description: Raised from the chilling depths of Icecrown, Frostbrood Vanquishers are considered among the fiercest and most relentless of all frost wyrms.

name: Violet Proto-Drake
description: I cannot help but wonder if things would have turned out different if the titans had elevated even one more dragonflight. -Alexstrasza

name: Volcanic Stone Drake
description: Fire can transform stone in exciting ways, but never let the Stonemother know I said that. -Earthcaller Yevaa

name: Highlord's Valorous Charger
description: Has many valorous points.

name: Celestial Steed
description: A beacon of hope; a guiding light in the darkness.

name: Magic Rooster
description: Magic in the hands of a genius can do wonderful, miraculous things. Magic in the hands of an idiot can make a giant rooster.

name: Vicious War Kodo
description: The spiked ball on the tail is strong enough to crush through even the most reinforced Alliance defenses.

name: Deathtusk Felboar
description: Veterans of the battle for Outland's Hellfire Peninsula are traumatized by thoughts of these beasts to this day.

name: Armored Siege Kodo
description: Only the strongest and most fearless of kodos can be trained to become living siege weapons. Even the highest walls won't keep them out for long.

name: Ironhoof Destroyer
description: Blackhand is said to have personally designed the fiery armaments used on the Iron Horde's clefthoof battle mounts.

name: Bloodbathed Frostbrood Vanquisher
description: Bloodbathed Vanquishers are so named when it is determined that a reanimated frost wyrm died a particularly gruesome and bloody death.

name: Frosty Flying Carpet
description: "I remember my first flying carpet... yeti hair and burlap.  Not nearly as nice as this one here." - Frozo the Renowned

name: Trained Riverwallow
description: Riverwallows are one of the heartiest beasts on Draenor, resulting in their increased stamina and distinctive coloring.

name: Cerulean Marsh Hopper
description: Gottum's expansion into export markets was inevitable with news of the Trading Post reaching even into the depths of the Frogmarsh.

name: Archmage's Prismatic Disc
description: Three elements have been fused to create this magical disc, which is attuned to your specific magical powers.

name: Grand Black War Mammoth
description: Rarely, a war mammoth is born stronger and more tractable than its peers. These mammoths are dubbed "grand" and carry more than one rider to the front lines.

name: Blue Shado-Pan Riding Tiger
description: "When waking a tiger, use a long stick. Better yet, tell your friend to wake the tiger instead." -Pandaren Proverb

name: Tundra Icehoof
description: A translucent layer of down hair covers this breed's leathery hide, acting as the perfect insulation for cold environments.

name: Great Northern Elderhorn
description: One of the heartiest of species that inhabit the slopes of Highmountain, they can survive for months in freezing blizzards.

name: Vicious War Raptor
description: Because sharp teeth and claws weren't enough.

name: Vicious Skeletal Warhorse
description: Only rewarded to those who have bested their foes in battle.

name: Black Drake
description: It never pays to leave a live dragon out of the equation.

name: Giant Coldsnout
description: Its snout is not just cold but wet. Not a pleasant way to wake up.

name: Red Dragonhawk
description: Dragonhawks are among the deadliest known predators. They are able to spot prey from great distances, rush in, and rend with both talon and beak.

name: Striped Dawnsaber
description: Night elves once believed that seeing this light colored saber breed in the wild was an ill omen.

name: Runebound Firelord
description: By fire be purged the obstacles in your path!

name: Black Polar Bear
description: The taunka use black polar bear pelts in their religious rites, usually at the funerals of those who hunt black polar bears.

name: Stormwind Steed
description: Although raised in Stormwind, this breed showed unusual aptitude for the cold weather in Icecrown.

name: Armored Frostwolf
description: It's trained to survive the harsh climate of Frostfire Ridge, so it snuggles as if its life depended on it.

name: Inferno Armoredon
description: Its tail smells like campfire but its breath smells like brimstone.

name: Ashhide Mushan Beast
description: Some people say that riding an ashhide mushan will result in favorable health and increased prosperity. These people are called "mount vendors."

name: Ban-Lu, Grandmaster's Companion
description: The child of Xuen, Ban-Lu has served each Grandmaster faithfully for many years.

name: White War Wolf
description: Can a wolf's hunger ever be satiated? These lupine brutes seek and devour the enemies of the Horde.

name: Garn Steelmaw
description: A trainer once tried to put decorative metal in his steelmaw wolf's mouth. He had to wait three days to get it back.

name: High Priest's Lightsworn Seeker
description: Once plentiful, only three seekers remain on Azeroth after generations of battling the corruption of the cosmos.

name: Swift Gray Steed
description: A veteran of some of the toughest battles fought by the Argent Crusade.

name: Fossilized Raptor
description: Legends tell of a spell placed upon a hunting raptor who dared to snarl at young Tyrande Whisperwind as she bathed in a jungle pool. The beast is cursed to wander Azeroth -  until it apologizes.

name: Emerald Hippogryph
description: These majestic animals come in various colorings, but the emerald variety can only be tamed by the magic of friendship.

name: Ironforge Ram
description: Wildhammer Fact Checker claims that this specific breed was the first type of ram domesticated by the dwarves when they settled in Dun Morogh.

name: Primal Gladiator's Felblood Gronnling
description: One of the gronnlings of Tanaan Jungle caught in the eruption of fel energies unleashed by Gul'dan, and now beholden to an unquenchable lust for chaos.

name: Solar Spirehawk
description: Looking into the eyes of this mystical beast is like peering into the heart of the sun. Goggles are recommended when you're riding.

name: Grinning Reaver
description: The difference between a smile and a grin is the difference between a kiss and tasting.

name: Onyxian Drake
description: She has a lot in common with her mother, except for the being killed and reanimated. But she is young still. -Maloriak

name: Cliffside Wylderdrake
description: Often roosting along the steep cliff faces of Thaldraszus, they're swift to the skies in times of danger.

name: Maddened Chaosrunner
description: The Army of the Light could only save so many of Argus' native species; countless numbers were lost to chaos.

name: Venomhide Ravasaur
description: You raised this thing from a scaly pup - Mor'vek would be so proud. But he'd still make you clean up the mess it made in the corner.

name: Kor'kron Juggernaut
description: The Kor'kron Juggernaut is a weapon of unbridled destruction, born from the mind of Garrosh Hellscream and made real by his engineers.

name: Dusty Rockhide
description: Ever since acquiring this mount, you have been plagued by strange fever dreams of hippety-hoppety clippety-cloppety elekk on parade.

name: Tyrannical Gladiator's Cloud Serpent
description: These cloud serpents always look elegant and slim in classic black.

name: Felblaze Infernal
description: The Illidari were able to break one of these fiery beasts for use as an unstoppable, fearless mount against the Legion.

name: Twilight Harbinger
description: Whatever dark magic once compelled the Twilight Harbinger is now broken... or is it?

name: Swift Windsteed
description: One of Pandaria's most elusive creatures, said to bring good fortune to its rider.

name: Voidtalon of the Dark Star
description: Corrupted by the presence of the Dark Star in Draenor, the Voidtalons resisted being broken by the Shadowmoon Clan and were ultimately destroyed by Ner'zhul. Only a single egg remains, lost in the void.

name: Warmongering Gladiator's Felblood Gronnling
description: One of the gronnlings of Tanaan Jungle caught in the eruption of fel energies unleashed by Gul'dan, and now beholden to an unquenchable lust for chaos.

name: Mudback Riverbeast
description: Special webbing that grows on the soles of the mudback's feet gives them extra traction in mud and slick terrain.

name: Ironside Warwolf
description: It has an armored spike on its tail. Scratch its belly at your own risk.

name: Sapphire Riverbeast
description: This animal's color mimics the clear blue of Draenor's river shallows, making it almost invisible to aquatic predators.

name: Beastlord's Warwolf
description: One of Darmac's trained beasts, it was raised in a crucible of molten fire and shows no fear.

name: Great Greytusk
description: Sheds its tusks once a year. Is extremely shy until they grow back.

name: Netherlord's Accursed Wrathsteed
description: Shadow plus fire, what could go wrong?

name: Chauffeured Mekgineer's Chopper
description: Transportation is a precise business.

name: Huntmaster's Loyal Wolfhawk
description: The spirit of the Great Hunter found you worthy, and now its children will answer your call forevermore.

name: Savage Ebony Battle Turtle
description: The cannons are powered by an unquenchable rage to seek out enemies and bring them to justice. Nothing can outrun a cannon.

name: Turbostrider
description: The mirror's not so you can look back, but so your foes can see something besides your tailpipes. -Rillie Spindlenut

name: Tamed Mauler
description: When it comes to taming devourers, all it takes is a little anima and a lot of patience. And a lot of healing potions.

name: Trained Silverpelt
description: Prized for its intelligence, this breed of talbuk can be trained to execute defensive kicks and gorings in battle.

name: Hearthsteed
description: Each step echoes with the rage of your three opponents.

name: Armored Irontusk
description: It is said an elekk never forgets. No wonder it despises the Iron Horde, considering the torment the orcs put the beast through.

name: Trained Snarler
description: Enormously cute as a puppy. Slightly less so now.

name: Lambent Mana Ray
description: Some of the natural wildlife of Argus, like the mana ray, has survived and adapted to life on the shattered world.

name: Blacksteel Battleboar
description: Refuses to run unless its head is covered in heavy, spiked metal. It's an ego thing.

name: Aquamarine Swarmite
description: While it's not exactly common, the representatives of the Severed Threads assure you that swarmites are more than capable of carrying your weight if you choose to ride it.

name: Royal Seafeather
description: The sharp beaks of these parrots are capable of breaking open large nuts with ease.

name: Wild Goretusk
description: If you want a gentle ride, go find a "tame happytusk" or something.

name: Relentless Gladiator's Frost Wyrm
description: In life, it could not be tamed, but necromancy and esoteric binding rituals have now combined to bend this indomitable creature to its rider's will.

name: Armored Frostboar
description: Subsists almost entirely on a diet of frozen berries. Though it finds slow off-worlders equally tasty.

name: Darkmoon Dirigible
description: Silas considered using his fleet of blimps for marketing, but decided that selling them directly was all the marketing he needed.

name: Grove Warden
description: These magical companions are the wardens of peaceful, primordial groves within the Emerald Dream.

name: Drake of the West Wind
description: Harnessing the elemental powers of the storm, these majestic beasts crackle like lightning and roar like thunder.

name: Blazing Drake
description: Blazing Drakes exhibit a boundless passion for life, and are considered by many to be among the most loyal mounts on Azeroth.

name: Deadly Gladiator's Frost Wyrm
description: These reanimated vessels of destruction do not fear death; they dispense it.

name: Infinite Timereaver
description: Fickle and savage, these drakes slip in and out of time until they find a worthy rider.

name: Armored Skyscreamer
description: Only those heroic souls who surmount every challenge the mogu tyrants place before them can proudly fly the skies on a war-prepared skyscreamer.

name: Felsaber
description: A special creation of Lord Illidan gifted to his most trusted demon hunters.

name: Warlord's Deathwheel
description: Often referred to as the "Goblin Lawn Mower", this growling behemoth treats enemies like they are made of grass... ready to be mown down.

name: Fearless Gladiator's Storm Dragon
description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

name: Prestigious Royal Courser
description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

name: Domesticated Razorback
description: "Domesticated" does not mean "friendly." Bring some treats.

name: Mechagon Peacekeeper
description: Keeps the peace by turning you into pieces.

name: Antoran Charhound
description: Sargeras' own hound was maybe once a felstalker, but over the years the Dark Titan reforged and reshaped his companion into something much more powerful. When, at last, he was pleased with his creation, he set about creating more of the hounds, and imbuing them with shadow and flame.

name: Corrupted Fire Hawk
description: Millagazor was a fire hawk loyal to Ragnaros. At this time it is unknown how many of Millagazor's eggs were corrupted.

name: Obsidian Worldbreaker
description: "I have had many names throughout history, all of them spoken with dread: Neltharion, Xaxas, and many more. Yet you shall know me best as Deathwing, for so I am! I am the bane of life, the darkness within history, the lord of death, the master of destruction. And I tell you now, and so it is true, that this world is mine!" - Neltharion, the Earth-Warder

name: Frightened Kodo
description: Nothing frightens a kodo like seeing a bear with antlers.

name: Crimson Slavermaw
description: Answers to a series of noises that cannot be made by non-demonic creatures but roughly translates to "Deathslobber."

name: Pureheart Courser
description: These coursers have long been known to exist, but only befriend those that have gone to great lengths for friendship.

name: Dominant Gladiator's Storm Dragon
description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

name: Vicious War Fox
description: Vicious as a fox.

name: Vicious Skyflayer
description: This creature hungers for battle with the contemptible Horde.

name: Ankoan Waveray
description: The Ankoan have been battling the naga for years, and with a natural affinity for the sea, training the local wildlife was a natural strategy.

name: Broken Highland Mustang
description: One of the Arathi horses, taken and broken by the Horde conquerors of Stromgarde.

name: Vicious War Clefthoof
description: The Mag'har bred clefthooves not only as sturdy pack animals, but also powerful instruments of war.

name: Swift Gray Ram
description: The Barak Tor'ol ram's thick bony skull and massive horns make it the ideal mount for charging through groups of armored enemies.

name: Surf Jelly
description: The time between being stung and being enveloped and devoured is short enough to consider not swimming in the Great Sea.

name: Wildseed Cradle
description: The most precious cargo in all Ardenweald, the wildseeds, are cradled by this lovingly-crafted cart. It is imbued with anima to allow it to hover over the ground.

name: Midnight
description: Still one of the most vicious steeds stabled in Karazhan.

name: Mollie
description: The kind nature of alpacas makes them perfect as companions for the intrepid adventurer.

name: X-51 Nether-Rocket
description: First designed as a booster for a much larger rocket, the X-51 was determined to give the perfect thrust capacity for a single rider payload.

name: Restoration Deathwalker
description: With the death of the Jailer and the ascension of a new Arbiter, the Shadowlands is returning to its great Purpose. Some deathwalkers recognize the role that mortal heroes have played, and are willing to serve as mounts.

name: Black Serpent of N'Zoth
description: The black serpents of N'Zoth are the harbingers of his ultimate vision becoming reality. Only those servants or enemies that can tread this space have any chance of wrangling them.

name: Swift Spectral Pterrordax
description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

name: Glacial Tidestorm
description: Though she commands a variety of magical powers, Jaina has always been most proficient at summoning powerful elementals of water and ice.

name: Azure Cloud Serpent
description: Azure Cloud Serpents are believed by the Pandaren to be harbingers of good fortune.

name: Sylverian Dreamer
description: An artist in the magical city of Dalaran fell asleep on her brush, and dreamed of painting a beautiful feathered dragon. Her artwork leapt from the page, and when she awoke, she found it sleeping gently beside her.

name: Eternal Phalynx of Loyalty
description: A marvel of steward engineering, the armored phalynx is a rare and awe-inspiring sight.

name: Ensorcelled Everwyrm
description: Anima is a fundamental force that infuses the Shadowlands. It flows through many creatures, but is also traded, bartered for, and fought over.

name: Vicious Black Warsaber
description: The only thing these big cats bring home as gifts are the severed limbs of your enemies.

name: Fabious
description: He emerges from the water, fins swaying lazily in the breeze, sun-kissed scales glittering. He is... Fabious.

name: Dazar'alor Windreaver
description: Soaring high above the Battle of Dazar'alor, these beasts are drawn to the most cunning of victors.

name: Sinfall Gargon
description: The gargon are the loyal mounts and companions of the Venthyr and Renathal has found many abandoned at Sinfall, awaiting reawakening and assignment to worthy members of the covenant.

name: Bound Shadehound
description: Created by deciphering and performing powerful runic magic, this Shadehound is bound to its creator.

name: Ardenweald Wilderling
description: As anima flows to the distant wealds of Ardenweald once more, the wilderlings awaken and cautiously emerge from their canopy burrows.

name: X-995 Mechanocat
description: The X-995 is the ultimate in customizeable feline robo-companionship.

name: Umber Ruinstrider
description: Talbuks, native to Argus, have evolved chitinous plates to survive the decades of ceaseless war that ravages the landscape.

name: Great Brewfest Kodo
description: Coren Direbrew won this prize after drinking a Tauren druid under the table - and the druid was in bear form. It was one of Direbrew's proudest moments.

name: Mail Muncher
description: Worming its way through the Postmaster's network, this serpent of N'Zoth deprived Azeroth of its primary magical correspondence.

name: Darkwater Skate
description: Little is known about this elusive species of ray, found only in the dark waters surrounding Darkmoon Island.

name: Plaguerot Tauralus
description: The tauralus is considered courageous, though scholars of Maldraxxus have long wondered if their lack of fear is simply due to the tiny size of their brains.

name: Gargantuan Grrloc
description: It's the biggest murloc you've ever seen!

name: Infested Necroray
description: Necrorays lay their eggs in small clusters within the frills and hollows of decaying fungal blooms.

name: Brown Riding Camel
description: Fennimore Quigley is credited with milking the first camel and breaking the record for "longest unintentional flight," all in the same afternoon.

name: Deepcoral Snapdragon
description: The snapdragon is a quiet hunter in the water, but is far less stealthy on land.

name: Enchanted Dreamlight Runestag
description: The majestic runestags are capable of siphoning anima from the ambient light of Ardenweald with their elaborate antlers. The anima is used as nourishment and to power the runestag's speed and magic.

name: Bloodthirsty Dreadwing
description: The forsaken prefer the use of these bloodthirsty hunters, both for their speed as a mount, and the psychological effect they have on their enemies.

name: Onyx Cloud Serpent
description: Onyx Cloud serpents are known to be more aggressive and daring than their cousins, the Heavenly Onyx Cloud Serpents.

name: Ivory Cloud Serpent
description: Ivory Cloud Serpents are often mistaken for roaring thunder as they tear through the skies with blistering speed.

name: Silvertip Dredwing
description: Bred by the Revendreth prince, Renathal, these rare dredwing are fiercely loyal and will only let those deemed worthy by the prince himself to interact with them.

name: Bulbous Necroray
description: The necrorays of Maldraxxus prefer to congregate around the enormous decaying mushrooms of the region.

name: Big Battle Bear
description: He's big, he's ready for battle, and he's a bear. What more could you want in a mount?

name: Winterborn Runestag
description: Winterborn runestags are blessed by the Winter Queen herself. Their runes flare brilliantly when predators are nearby, warning the entire herd.

name: Clutch of Ha-Li
description: The brood of Ha-Li are comfortable in the blue skies of Pandaria, hunting unsuspecting prey.

name: Crusader's Direhorn
description: A loyal steed to the holy crusaders of Zandalar.

name: Red Qiraji Battle Tank
description: This (relatively) domesticated silithid is at home only in the desert sands of Ahn'Qiraj.

name: Twilight Avenger
description: Little is known about the fate of the twilight dragonflight, though they seem to exist in numbers in Grim Batol to this day.

name: Gruesome Flayedwing
description: The flayedwings of Maldraxxus are prized for their ability to soar effortlessly through the skies of the Shadowlands, allowing their rider a surprise opportunity to strike at their foes or support their allies.

name: Swift Timber Wolf
description: The wolves of the Horde are befriended, not domesticated.

name: Meat Wagon
description: A favorite unit of the Lich King, both for its power as a siege weapon, and the satisfying sound of flung meat.

name: Stormwind Skychaser
description: "Give me all the engines you got." - Engineer Cogspinner

name: Explorer's Dunetrekker
description: The surly dunetrekker can easily carry a set of explorers to the nearest ruins and back without the need to rest.

name: Squeakers, the Trickster
description: The locals in Halfhill swear that whenever a batch of grain is missing, a farmworking instrument is misplaced, or a bushel of berries can't be found, you can hear a mischievous squeaking, and are reminded to slow down and accept what life gives you.

name: Tan Riding Camel
description: Fennimore Quigley is credited with milking the first camel and breaking the record for "longest unintentional flight," all in the same afternoon.

name: Colossal Slaughterclaw
description: Only the most stalwart stable masters of Maldraxxus are able to break the will of the colossal slaughterclaws, giving all champions of the Undying Army a fearsome ally in the Shadowlands.

name: Mawsworn Soulhunter
description: Soulhunters are used to track wayward souls across the wastes that flee from their dark fates, and are one of the only creatures that feel comfortable traversing the maw.

name: Swift Nether Drake
description: The most aggressive nether drakes were awarded those heroes who showed significant prowess and commitment in the gladiatorial arena.

name: Sandstone Drake
description: Sandstone Drakes were studied in great detail long ago by the famed alchemist Walleye Sprysprocket. It has even been said that Walleye developed potions to mimic the drakes' physiology.

name: Pale Acidmaw
description: The acid present in the ichor of this creature sapped away the color from its shell, leaving it a striking shade of snowy white.

name: Ol' Mole Rufus
description: Wiser than words can say and still quick on his feet. He just gets a lil' tired sometimes.

name: Magenta Cloud Serpent
description: More affectionate than their cousins, Magenta Cloud Serpents are known to form close bonds with their riders.

name: Eternal Phalynx of Courage
description: Many bars of gildenite are required to forge one of these sparkling mounts, but the sight of them alone is worth the gathering time.

name: Vicious War Spider
description: When being a courageous member of the Alliance doesn't strike the right amount of fear into your opponent, add a giant spider.

name: Inquisition Gargon
description: The gargon of the Inquisitors are some of the most vicious ever carved. The Avowed seek to recapture these beasts and return them to the righteous duty of assisting in the purifying of souls rather than the perversions performed at the hands of the Inquisitors.

name: Great Blue Dragon Turtle
description: "Packaged upgrades include; dual-lantern fog lights, emergency brew keg, and genuine Tanji leather seat."  - Turtlemaster Odai

name: Caravan Hyena
description: The canopy atop this dune-wanderer can be stored at your campsite, should you desire to feel the wind in your fur.

name: Junkheap Drifter
description: When you really want to be noticed... and don't mind strapping yourself to a giant, barely-held-together wheel.

name: Enchanted Winterborn Runestag
description: Winterborn runestags are the favored mount of the Winter Queen herself, and she only bestows such a creature on her most favored subjects.

name: Bonehoof Tauralus
description: There are quite a few reasons that you do not want to stand behind a tauralus, the hooves and whip-like tails being the least of them.

name: Phalynx of Loyalty
description: Some within the Ascended keep a phalynx as a pet. While they may not be as furry as a larion, they are much less likely to eat your other pets.

name: Ashenvale Chimaera
description: Ashenvale chimaeras were used frequently by the Kaldorei to decimate structures in battles against the humans, orcs, and undead.

name: Tawny Wind Rider
description: After being freed from vicious harpies by Cairne and Thrall, many of these creatures became valuable companions of the Horde.

name: X-51 Nether-Rocket X-TREME
description: What it lacks in safety features it more than makes up for in speed and style.  Not for the faint of heart.

name: Cenarion War Hippogryph
description: Members of the Cenarion Circle have shared a long and prosperous partnership with their hippogryph allies. When conflict is unavoidable, the Cenarion War Hippogryph is called into service.

name: Lil' Donkey
description: Likely stolen from Newstead in the Arathi Highlands, this stalwart little donkey was destined to be eaten by kobolds.

name: Umbral Scythehorn
description: Umbral gorm are the most docile of all gorm, but they also grow the largest horns and mandibles. They are probably so docile because other creatures avoid riling them.

name: Loyal Gorger
description: Crawling forth from the cracks between the realms, the devourers have a voracious appetite for anima. Little is known of their origins, but all denizens of the Shadowlands see their recent boldness as a sign of the end times.

name: Bloodgorged Crawg
description: This crawg was left alone to feast on G'huun's corrupted blood and rot. He was so happy.

name: Black Qiraji Battle Tank
description: Although many varieties of Qiraji Battle Tank can still be found in the ruins of Ahn'Qiraj today, the darkest of the species were only seen on the day the Scarab gong was rung.

name: Drake of the Four Winds
description: Rocks erode, fires sputter, but wind remains powerful regardless of the passage of time. -Phaoris

name: Gravestone Battle Gargon
description: Representative of a new loyal batch of gargon, these battle ready beasts will take Renathal's most loyal compatriots into the final battles against the Jailer.

name: Swift White Hawkstrider
description: I may question Prince Kael'thas's loyalties, but never his style. -Elrodan

name: Voyaging Wilderling
description: These playful visitors from another realm thrive while traveling to new lands with new friends.

name: Orgrimmar Interceptor
description: A forward-mounted wolf's head cannon makes this air superiority fighter especially good at dogfighting.

name: Crusty Crawler
description: This rare giant crab has taken a break from its nautical nonsense deep under the sea to explore the surface.

name: Leywoven Flying Carpet
description: The threads are so thin and well-stitched, you can't imagine it wasn't made by magic, strand by strand.

name: Turbo-Charged Flying Machine
description: Only the most talented engineers have the courage and the mental stamina to create a flying machine that boasts stability and safety.  Turbo-charging one is just crazy!

name: Swift Gloomhoof
description: The ballads of Ardenweald claim that the birth of gloomrunner heralds the passing of a particularly benevolent wild god. Seeing a gloomrunner is therefore a blessing and a curse.

name: Crypt Gargon
description: Loyal hounds of the Curator, these gargon patrol the crypts and catacombs deterring both trespassing and escape.

name: The Dreadwake
description: A ship unlike any other, held aloft by a gift from an unknown kraken-faced god of the deeps.

name: Big Blizzard Bear
description: Whenever you ride this mount, you feel the urge to shout, "Cry havoc and let slip the murlocs of war!"

name: Snowstorm
description: He comes from the ice and snow, under the Azeroth sun where adventurers go.

name: Swift Spectral Gryphon
description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

name: Fathom Dweller
description: Deep within the hungering chasms of the Great Sea, swarms of Fathom Dwellers sway like a great floating carpet, sightlessly in the dark.

name: Arcadian War Turtle
description: Bred for destruction by an insane warlord in a far-off land, but at least the seat is warm.

name: Rocktusk Battleboar
description: It's not the metal helmet that attracts mates; it's the sweet mohawk.

name: Prestigious War Wolf
description: At Warchief Hellscream's command, Horde trainers began raising wolves to thrive in the shock and ferocity of sustained combat.

name: Arcanist's Manasaber
description:
Upon her return to The Nighthold, First Arcanist Thalyssra saw to it that adventurers who helped her liberate Suramar were rewarded with prized mounts from the royal stable.

Summoning this mount in Suramar City will also apply Masquerade.

name: Seething Slug
description: Drawn forth from its abyss by the rage of the Zaqali.

name: Riddler's Mind-Worm
description: It feeds on your thoughts, even the ones you are thinking as you read this.

name: Long-Forgotten Hippogryph
description: You are the only one that remembered.

name: Shadowblade's Murderous Omen
description: The preferred vehicle for assassinations, they make no sounds when flying - really great for sneaking up on people.

name: Spectral Pterrorwing
description: Vengeful spectres abound in the spirit realm surrounding Dazar'alor.

name: Pale Thorngrazer
description: This talbuk subsists completely on a diet of thistles and thorns, making its insides as tough as its outside.

name: Vicious War Scorpion
description: Has very few non-pointy ends.

name: Highlord's Vengeful Charger
description: What's he so mad about?

name: Vicious War Trike
description: The most devastating technology money can buy.

name: Swift Spectral Hippogryph
description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

name: Black Qiraji War Tank
description: The Qiraji War Tank has only been seen recently during the Call of the Scarab, could this hint at a resurfacing of the deadly creatures?

name: Rustbolt Resistor
description: "R E S I S T" is carved into the seat in crude letters, along with several, more profane things.

name: Antoran Gloomhound
description: Sargeras' own hound was maybe once a felstalker, but over the years the Dark Titan reforged and reshaped his companion into something much more powerful. When, at last, he was pleased with his creation, he set about creating more of the hounds, and imbuing them with shadow and flame.

name: Felfire Hawk
description: Felfire is deadly to the touch.  Luckily, the hawk can suppress the flames, choosing not to incinerate its rider in an emerald effigy.

name: Shackled Ur'zul
description: Formed from the tormented bodies and souls of fallen members of the Army of the Light, the Ur'zul is both fascinating and horrifying.

name: Violet Spellwing
description: A gift from the Council of Six for saving Azeroth from the threat of the Legion once more.

name: Seabraid Stallion
description: Horses in the Kul Tiran military are bred from an early age not to fear the sea, and revel in galloping along the shoreline and through the spray.

name: Highlord's Golden Charger
description: The fanciest of all of the horses.

name: Beastlord's Irontusk
description: One of Darmac's trained beasts, its tusks can pierce even the hardest Iron Horde steel.

name: Goldenmane
description: Lord Stormsong ordered his cronies to steal this horse from the Norwington Estate in Tiragarde, as he was covetous of its luscious golden mane.

name: Wild Gladiator's Felblood Gronnling
description: One of the gronnlings of Tanaan Jungle caught in the eruption of fel energies unleashed by Gul'dan, and now beholden to an unquenchable lust for chaos.

name: Valarjar Stormwing
description: The beating of its wings sound like the rolling of thunder in the distance.

name: Highmountain Thunderhoof
description: A gift from the tauren who trained this sure-footed highland moose to safely traverse the paths and peaks of Highmountain.

name: Terrified Pack Mule
description: This poor mule was around Drustvar when the witches took over. He's seen too much.

name: Cloudwing Hippogryph
description: Moreso than normal hippogryphs, the cloudwings of Azsuna prefer to nest high up in mountain caves far above the cloud line.

name: Bleakhoof Ruinstrider
description: The Army of the Light could only save so many of Argus' native species; countless numbers were lost to chaos.

name: Scintillating Mana Ray
description: Some of the natural wildlife of Argus, like the mana ray, has survived and adapted to life on the shattered world.

name: Breezestrider Stallion
description: These breezestriders' red coloration reflects their temperament: sanguine, fierce, and courageous.

name: Glorious Felcrusher
description: After Alleria and Turalyon explained the usefulness of the Draenei's long-time companion animal, the Army of the Light brought several into the fold for training.

name: Leyfeather Hippogryph
description: Ancient mounts of the Highborne, now left to run wild in the Broken Isles, they can rarely be found due to their latent magical powers.

name: Amani Dragonhawk
description: Dragonhawks liberated from troll enslavement are considered among the most loyal of all their kin.

name: Mechanized Lumber Extractor
description: Jepetto may have over done it a little...

name: Vicious Gilnean Warhorse
description: Born, bred and battle tested in Gilneas.

name: Netherlord's Chaotic Wrathsteed
description: A deadly combination of fel and horse.

name: Undercity Plaguebat
description: One of the last of the giant bats to escape Undercity following the siege of Lordaeron.

name: Blessed Felcrusher
description: After Alleria and Turalyon explained the usefulness of the Draenei's long-time companion animal, the Army of the Light brought several into the fold for training.

name: Leaping Veinseeker
description: Bug spray and a hat with netting aren't going to do much in the swamps of Nazmir, bring a club.

name: Vicious War Turtle
description: Now you can literally turtle up in the flag room.

name: Grand Expedition Yak
description: These beasts of burden are known to carry over five times their own weight and to be capable of lasting several days without food or water.

name: Vicious War Basilisk
description: Its breath is worse than its bite.

name: Admiralty Stallion
description: These sleek white stallions are the few mounts allowed to embark on Kul Tiran ships.

name: Sable Ruinstrider
description: Talbuks, native to Argus, have evolved chitinous plates to survive the decades of ceaseless war that ravages the landscape.

name: Snapback Scuttler
description: Giant crabs are native to Nazjatar and a favored food of the naga. This one must have been well-kept to grow this large.

name: Frostwolf Snarler
description: Raised in the Alterac Mountains by the Frostwolf Clan, trained to bite dwarves.

name: Russet Ruinstrider
description: Talbuks, native to Argus, have evolved chitinous plates to survive the decades of ceaseless war that ravages the landscape.

name: The Hivemind
description: A true union of minds.

name: Acid Belcher
description: Twice as acid-filled as the usual fiend.

name: Amber Scorpion
description: The Klaxxi ride massive scorpions into battle against their enemies.  A carapace hardened by amber provides superior protection while on the battlefield.

name: Stonehide Elderhorn
description: Stonehide elderhorns, one of the few types of moose to inhabit island climates, have thinner fur than most elderhorns.

name: Fiery Hearthsteed
description: These flying creatures thunder unseen across the heavens. How fortunate that this one has shown itself to you!

name: Ny'alotha Allseer
description: To find him, drown yourself in the Circle of Stars.

name: Fierce Gladiator's Storm Dragon
description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

name: Cobalt Pterrordax
description: These pterrordax keep vigil for enemy fleets soaring above the coasts of Zandalar.

name: Yellow Marsh Hopper
description: No one makes giant, slimy spawns like Krag'wa the Huge.

name: Russet Bufonid
description: Russet is a rare color among bufonids that is normally only seen on specimens that are tainted by other cosmic forces, or synthesized from a perplexing schematic that invokes that color.

name: Siltwing Albatross
description: One of the rarest of birds seen on the islands of the Great Sea, and a prized possession amongst traders, if they can capture it.

name: Stormpike Battle Ram
description: Raised in the Alterac Mountains by the Stormpike Clan, trained to headbutt orcs.

name: Smoky Charger
description: Among the oldest horse breeds in Kul Tiras, they even led many a charge in the original struggle with the drust.

name: Underrot Crawg
description: The eternal twilight of the Underrot has robbed this crawg of all pigmentation.

name: Tomb Stalker
description: These fierce beasts are entombed alongside kings so they may carry their masters through the afterlife.

name: Palehide Direhorn
description: Pale-skinned direhorns are quite rare, justifying the expense.

name: Explorer's Jungle Hopper
description: For when you're making a crash landing in the middle of an uncharted swamp because it's the only way to access that ancient temple.

name: Notorious Gladiator's Proto-Drake
description: They say that proto-drakes can smell fear. This iron-bound monster FEEDS off of it.

name: Silent Glider
description: Gasses naturally stored within the creature allowed it to survive within the depths, those same gasses also allow them to effortlessly float through the air.

name: Swift Spectral Fathom Ray
description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

name: Blue Marsh Hopper
description: That squishing sound every time it takes a step? That's a feature.

name: G.M.O.D.
description: Garishly sporting extreme amounts of goblin flair, Gallywix commissioned his Mech of Death to one up Mekkatorque in combat and more importantly in style.

name: Rajani Warserpent
description: Fierce companions of the followers of Ra-den, the Rajani Warserpents are a force to be reckoned with.

name: Corrupted Gladiator's Proto-Drake
description: They say that proto-drakes can smell fear. This iron-bound monster FEEDS off of it.

name: Blackpaw
description: Blackpaw was just hibernating, minding his own business, and then suddenly there was a warfront.

name: Savage Raptor
description: One-time companion of Kanga the Primal, the fallen troll hero. The raptor's name is unknown, for Kanga only spoke to it in bear form.

name: Qinsho's Eternal Hound
description: Qinsho wrought his eternal guardian from pure gold and imbued it with the resilience of the earth.

name: Flameward Hippogryph
description: Flameward Hippogryphs revel in the defeat of Ragnaros, Lord of Fire.

name: Pureblood Fire Hawk
description: Legends state that the Pureblood line may be traced back to the very creation of the Firelands.

name: Luminous Starseeker
description: Energetic apex hunters of Argus, the panthara hunt by sensing the energy within living things. A panthara approaching a powerful energy source will visibly change color and become more excited.

name: Rusty Mechanocrawler
description: The check engine light is always on, it's when it goes off that you should be worried.

name: Prestigious Azure Courser
description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

name: Nazjatar Blood Serpent
description: Monstrous serpents riddled with corruption serve as mounts for N'zoth's high-ranking lieutenants in the Great Sea.

name: Proudmoore Sea Scout
description: Only a few gryphons are selected to be Sea Scouts operating from flag ships in the fleet. Their long range reconnaissance is an integral part of Kul Tiran sea dominance.

name: Priestess' Moonsaber
description: Once these elegant cats were only given to high-ranking priestesses of Elune, but now they ride into battle with all manner of champion, in the service of vengeance.

name: Sandy Nightsaber
description: A rare color for a nightsaber, and rarely seen, they are prized amongst huntresses.

name: Lucky Yun
description: The Pandaren believe that merely rubbing one's hands on the shiny hide of the ox will grant prosperity, the challenge is catching it.

name: Flying Machine
description: The backbone of the Alliance air force is comprised predominantly of gnomish flying machines due to their maneuverability and speed.

name: Expedition Bloodswarmer
description: Orphaned during the rout of the Blood Trolls, this bloodswarmer has been retrained by Talanji's handlers.

name: Brawler's Burly Basilisk
description: The spikes on this beast can pierce plate armor with ease -- only the most elite riders can even consider mounting this deadly pincushion.

name: Sinister Gladiator's Proto-Drake
description: They say that proto-drakes can smell fear. This iron-bound monster FEEDS off of it.

name: Rubyshell Krolusk
description: Captured from the desolate sands of Vol'dun, this mount is surprisingly docile in captivity.

name: Prestigious Midnight Courser
description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

name: Crimson Tidestallion
description: The blood-red coloration of these creatures is ideal for hiding in large coral formations.

name: Dusky Waycrest Gryphon
description: Common to the dark forests of Drustvar, these gryphon are silent and swift. Their prowess at operating on their own or as mounts lends them to be used for ambush and shock tactics.

name: Azureshell Krolusk
description: Captured from the desolate sands of Vol'dun, this mount is surprisingly docile in captivity.

name: Mighty Caravan Brutosaur
description: Brutosaurs are used by the Zandalari Empire as both weapons of war and enormous, mobile trading posts.

name: Vicious Warstrider
description: Exquisite, dignified and deadly.

name: Silver Tidestallion
description: This tidestallion and its silvery scales were drawn to the glint of plunder in your pocket.

name: Shadowflame Shalewing
description: Born from the magma, its carapace was originally molten blobs cooled to form dark-colored volcanic rock. Being imbued by shadowflame has only solidified its unbreakable nature.

name: Machine Defense Unit 1-11
description: One of many such mechsuits designed to guard the Machine. After years of faithful service it is no longer suited for combat. It does make for an impressive conveyance, though.

name: Winter Night Dreamsaber
description: These nocturnal dreamsabers carry the chill of winter with them and will often hibernate for days on end if not otherwise awoken.

name: Rekindled Dreamstag
description: Ashes of fallen leaves are fertile soil for dreamstags to arise from.

name: Eve's Ghastly Rider
description: The preferred transportation of the Fenlow family (especially during Hallow's End).

name: Kor'kron War Wolf
description: The Kor'kron use only the mightiest wolves for their mounts, bedecking them in armor that would break the backs of lesser creatures.

name: Rose Riding Crane
description: This brightly-colored bird is often confused with a flamingo or marabou.

name: Winding Slitherdrake
description: These drakes feel at home in the depths of the earth and the far reaches of the sky.

name: Azshari Bloatray
description: The naga raised these rays in captivity, harvesting their gas organs to craft alchemy which allowed them to breathe air more easily.

name: Vicious War Snail
description: The Alliance uses these ravenous snail mounts to traverse over any obstacle in battlefields.

name: Armored Razorback
description: Never... ever... EVER... let it smell bacon on you.

name: Fel Iron Juggernaut
description: This war machine was stolen from a timeline in which Garrosh Hellscream joined the Burning Legion. Suffice it to say, there is not much left of that timeline.

name: Springtide Dreamtalon
description: Surging with the kind of energy and enthusiasm that can make anyone envious.

name: Tan War Talbuk
description: Despite their docile nature, talbuks have been known to gore seasoned warriors to death when threatened.

name: Imagiwing
description: There's nothing more beautiful than watching your imagination take flight.

name: Tropical Riding Crane
description: This Jade Forest native uses its coloration as camouflage.

name: Armored Plaguerot Tauralus
description: When fully armored, a tauralus can take an incredible amount of damage before falling, making it a valuable ally in battle.

name: August Phoenix
description: The magnificent August Phoenixes are blessed by Chi-Ji to fill the hearts of riders with wonder and hope for the future.

name: Morning Flourish Dreamsaber
description: Known for the lavish energy that emanates from them, these sabers are notorious tricksters. Their roar scatters the early birds that wake them.

name: Big Slick in the City
description: Big heart, big dreams, Big Slick.

name: Felglow Mana Ray
description: The Army of the Light could only save so many of Argus' native species; countless numbers were lost to chaos.

name: Calescent Shalewing
description: A shalewing born in the wake of Fyrakk's destructive breach. Cursed by his primal flame, its temperature slowly but constantly rises. It must immerse itself in water to cool off periodically, lest its own heat smother it.

name: Dustmane Direwolf
description: Cautious by direwolf standards, the dustmane can only be coaxed to ride with something it considers special.

name: Stargrazer
description: One can't help but think what it might feel like to pluck the stars from their fixture in the sky. Perhaps, Stargrazer will show us how someday.

name: Sinrunner Blanchy
description: In life, Blanchy appeared to be an affectionate, well-behaved horse of excellent disposition and appetite. What evils must she have committed in secret to have earned her place among the condemned souls of Revendreth?

name: Compass Rose
description: Pried from a giant Hearthstone game box.

name: Jade Cloud Serpent
description: Jade Cloud Serpents are light and agile; quick and deadly.

name: Frostshard Infernal
description: These icy minions come from an unknown plane far from this one.

name: Wonderwing 2.0
description: Don't ask what happened to the first one -- Mechagon technology is still gnome technology!

name: Mechagon Mechanostrider
description: The best mount, logically, serves multiple purposes -- sometimes you need to get places AND reach something high up once you get there.

name: Sundancer
description: This sun-dappled courser gallops on lightbeams with carefree abandon.

name: Merciless Nether Drake
description: The most aggressive nether drakes were awarded those heroes who showed significant prowess and commitment in the gladiatorial arena.

name: Vicious White Warsaber
description: If you try to give it a belly scratch, you're asking for trouble.

name: Shu-Zen, the Divine Sentinel
description: As the Golden Lotus worked tirelessly to repair the Vale of Eternal Blossoms, a single statue came to life and wordlessly defended them from the Sha that assaulted them. Believed by some to be a sign of good fortune and others to be a gift from the Light, Shu-Zen provides faithful companionship to any that would defend Azeroth from the maddening whispers of the Old Gods.

name: Black War Elekk
description: Uniquely aggressive and pugnacious elekk bulls are culled from the herd and sold to Ethereal traders. The traders then train the bulls for combat and sell them to owners unconcerned about safety.

name: Ironclad Frostclaw
description: Captured in the snows of Alterac Valley, this bloodthirsty hunter now roars for the Alliance.

name: Vicious War Lion
description: Many squires were harmed in the making of this mount.

name: Blue Wind Rider
description: After being freed from vicious harpies by Cairne and Thrall, many of these creatures became valuable companions of the Horde.

name: Swift Gray Wolf
description: The wolves of the Horde are befriended, not domesticated.

name: Dark Riding Talbuk
description: The orcs once hunted these graceful herd animals as part of the om'riggor rite of passage ceremony.

name: Dreamlight Runestag
description: Runestags are granted to those who have pledged their service to the Winter Queen and the Court of Night.

name: Pandaren Kite
description: This "mount," awarded by the Lorewalkers of Pandaria, is a reward to the hero of their organization.

name: Armored Blue Wind Rider
description: They are not native to Northrend, but they have adapted extremely well to the cold. -Mei Francis

name: Highwind Darkmane
description: The Forsworn and their mounts take on a darker aspect upon renouncing the path laid forth by the Archon. While tame enough to ride, the Highwind Darkmane has a fiercely independent streak.

name: Riding Turtle
description: Slow and steady might not always win you the race but it'll get you there... eventually.

name: Veridian Netherwing Drake
description: After promising to fly you to the ends of Outland, the netherwing drake was eventually drawn to the blue skies of Azeroth as well.

name: Witherbark Direwing
description: Only a handful of these giant bats remain in the Arathi Highlands, carefully raised by the Witherbark forest trolls who first brought them here.

name: Enchanted Wakener's Runestag
description: Wakener runestags fiercely protect their wildseed groves. When the groves starting to fail, many runestags went berserk.

name: Dapple Gray
description: A favored mount of the sea priests who call Stormsong home.

name: Awakened Mindborer
description: It may look menacing right now, but it's actually kind of cute when it's asleep.

name: Depleted-Kyparium Rocket
description: When Kyparite is depleted of its amber essence it becomes fairly resistant to the corrosion from rocket fuel.

name: Yu'lei, Daughter of Jade
description: Warmth and wisdom emanate from this great creature, which glows like moonlight passing through the finest jade.

name: Ebon Gryphon
description: They love lions in Stormwind, and the gryphon is half lion. Of course they might not like which half. -Gryphon Master Talonaxe

name: Swift Zhevra
description: Zhevras are rarely used as mounts in Azeroth due to their stubborn nature and tendency to bite.

name: Golden Gryphon
description: They love lions in Stormwind, and the gryphon is half lion. Of course they might not like which half. -Gryphon Master Talonaxe

name: Golden King
description: Don't let the saddle fool you, he's wild, not a tame lion.

name: Swift Blue Gryphon
description: The Horde had dragons, we had the gryphons. We won that war. - Ilsa Blusterbrew

name: Green Qiraji Battle Tank
description: This (relatively) domesticated silithid is at home only in the desert sands of Ahn'Qiraj.

name: Mottled Drake
description: I thought the thing was ill until it took to the air. It flies as true as any of my own. -Alexstrasza

name: Great Red Dragon Turtle
description: "Packaged upgrades include; dual-lantern fog lights, emergency brew keg, and genuine Tanji leather seat."  - Turtlemaster Odai

name: Armored War-Bred Tauralus
description: The tauralus that serve the armies of Maldraxxus have had all traits of compassion bred out of them, and are only adorned in armor when they show that no sword or spell can stop them from carrying their rider to victory.

name: Swift Zhevra
description: Zhevras are rarely used as mounts in Azeroth due to their stubborn nature and tendency to bite.

name: Cobalt Riding Talbuk
description: The orcs once hunted these graceful herd animals as part of the om'riggor rite of passage ceremony.

name: Armored Bonehoof Tauralus
description: A favored mount of the House of the Chosen, the tauralus only gets more angry and vicious when exposed to battle.

name: Black War Bear
description: Killing leaders of the Horde is its own reward, but this intimidating beast is an excellent memento.

name: Highland Mustang
description: A valiant steed on the Arathi Highlands, it knows no fear.

name: Purple Riding Nether Ray
description: Nether Rays are among the most trusted, versatile mounts in all of Outland and beyond.

name: Bronze Drake
description: Lost time is never found again. Oh, never mind I found it. -Chronormu

name: Gnomeregan Mechanostrider
description: When you absolutely, positively have to be there right now. -Rillie Spindlenut

name: Armored Chosen Tauralus
description: The tauralus has two tails, which are both absolutely necessary for whipping away buzzing pests like the bloodlouse.

name: Spectral Wolf
description: Fears only fire.

name: Callow Flayedwing
description: Flayedwings are a necessary force in the cycle of life for the Shadowlands, acting as both prey and predator for the harsh environment of Maldraxxus.

name: Chittering Animite
description: These exceptionally agile fliers make excellent mounts once they've been trained not to sap every ounce of anima from their rider.

name: Spectral Wind Rider
description: How do you not fall right through that thing? -Maztha

name: Onyx Netherwing Drake
description: After promising to fly you to the ends of Outland, the netherwing drake was eventually drawn to the blue skies of Azeroth as well.

name: Red Flying Cloud
description: An ancient mogu artifact awarded to those who are deeply committed to the discovery and sharing of Pandaren lore.

name: Ruthless Gladiator's Twilight Drake
description: Heroes who proved their might in the gladiatorial arenas during the Cataclysm were awarded the most exceptional of the twilight drake broods.

name: Nightborne Manasaber
description: Born capable of sniffing out concentrations of arcane energy, this noble cat was presented with thanks to a proven ally of the nightborne.

name: Yellow Qiraji Battle Tank
description: This (relatively) domesticated silithid is at home only in the desert sands of Ahn'Qiraj.

name: Ultramarine Qiraji Battle Tank
description: The Tol'vir sorcerer Azj'Aqir was said to possess a scepter that would allow him to control a Qiraj battle tank outside of its Silithus home.

name: Blue Proto-Drake
description: The Storm Peaks! There we will find the beast strong enough to bear me into battle. -Skadi the Ruthless

name: Azure Netherwing Drake
description: After promising to fly you to the ends of Outland, the netherwing drake was eventually drawn to the blue skies of Azeroth as well.

name: Ashen Pandaren Phoenix
description: Both the name and color of this majestic phoenix are believed to symbolize rebirth.

name: Bestowed Sandskimmer
description: A gift from Granpap Whiskers, these capricious skitterflies help the Timewalkers clean up present (and future) sand-related temporal calamities.

name: Autumnal Wilderling
description: The wilderlings are benevolent, magical creatures of Ardenweald, and are drawn to souls that are strong and pure.

name: Son of Galleon
description: Trained from a young age, these massive Mushan are taught to thunder into battle carrying a full saurok warband.

name: Snowy Gryphon
description: They love lions in Stormwind, and the gryphon is half lion. Of course they might not like which half. -Gryphon Master Talonaxe

name: Bloodhoof Bull
description: Members of the Warsong clan have long hunted these clefthoof to use their crimson-hued skin for battle standards.

name: Mountain Horse
description: Images of this breed are often found on kegs of watered-down dwarven brew.

name: Sunhide Gronnling
description: Loves the sun, hates everything else.

name: Argent Hippogryph
description: Argent Hippogryphs will partner with only the bravest and most battle-tested champions.

name: Argent Warhorse
description: Given only to those who prove themselves a champion in the Argent Tournament.

name: Prestigious Ivory Courser
description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

name: Great Exarch's Elekk
description: Only the most distinguished paladins are given the honor of riding this elekk. Its plated armor and purple adornments have been blessed by Prophet Velen himself.

name: Pale Riding Crane
description: I looked, and behold, a pale... crane?

name: Forest Windsteed
description: The fur of this Windsteed is not only colored to match its woodland home, but also usually contains bits of bark and leaves.

name: Boulder Hauler
description: These shalewings have been specially trained to carry large amounts of Barter Boulders for the niffen's bartering activities.

name: Primal Flamesaber
description: The primal landscape of Azeroth was once swarming with elemental creatures of all types.

name: Remembered Golden Gryphon
description: They love lions in Stormwind, and the gryphon is half lion. This is why these creatures are an air travel staple throughout the Alliance.

name: Crimson Shardhide
description: When Korthia was pulled into The Maw, only a few hardy species survived.

name: Scourgebound Vanquisher
description: Once bound in service to the Scourge, these undead dragons exist only to spread death, disease, and destruction.

name: Amber Shardhide
description: The bright colors of Korthian wildlife indicate that they have either few predators, or are tough enough to fight back.

name: Vicious War Basilisk
description: Its breath is worse than its bite.

name: Coral-Stalker Waveray
description: This species of ray seems to have evolved to stalk its prey amidst the brightly colored corals of the seas.

name: Grey Riding Yak
description: Riding Yaks are bred to be slimmer and more agile than their kin.

name: Vibrant Flutterwing
description: These minty green moths are very friendly. They particularly enjoy having their head fuzz vigorously brushed. They also enjoy music and poetry.

name: Nether-Gorged Greatwyrm
description: Few mana wyrms find sufficiently stable sources of arcane power to reach such a size. A greatwyrm's appetite for mana is unmatched.

name: Quawks
description: Squawks's older (and somehow louder) brother appears to tolerate your presence. For now. You should probably track down some crackers while you still can.

name: Green Primal Raptor
description: "Raptors are as loyal as they are vicious. If you ain't friend, you are food." -Kijara

name: Bestowed Trawling Mammoth
