description: A gift from Scout Tomul, so that the feasts of Iskaara will always have enough fish to feed those in need.

name: Underlight Shorestalker
description: Aid your deep sea charger in its hunt for prey along the ocean floors.

name: Subterranean Magmammoth
description: Awakened from a long slumber, this beast has yet to see the light of day.

name: Bloody Skyscreamer
description: This dinosaur still harbors the rage of its ancestors from the Zandalari Invasion.

name: Llothien Prowler
description: These sleek foxes can prowl amongst newly-fallen leaves without making a sound, even at this size.

name: Clayscale Hornstrider
description: Named for their dusty-red appearance, clayscale hornstriders can be found tearing across the muddy hills of the Ohn'ahran Plains.

name: Inkscale Deepseeker
description: Schools of tidestallions will viciously slam their muscular chests into their prey to take them down.

name: Green Marsh Hopper
description: Gottum collects spawns of Krag'wa from all around the Frogmarsh, but only the most bulbous are used as mounts.

name: Eclipse Dragonhawk
description: Captured from the renegade blood elves at Eclipse Point, these purple dragonhawks were often sought after by Scryers posted to the Sanctum of the Stars.

name: Beledar's Spawn
description: Through the Sacred Flame, whispers of dark carry you to battle.

name: Guardian Quilen
description: When Quan the Relentless fell in battle, his loyal hounds waited for his return. Millenia later, they remain patient.

name: Heavenly Onyx Cloud Serpent
description: Heavenly Onyx Cloud Serpents are born with violet scales covering the entirety of their body. Over time, these scales darken to the color of onyx.

name: Dashing Windsteed
description: Windsteeds are incredibly gentle and easy to train... if you can catch one.

name: Prestigious Bloodforged Courser
description: Forged in a fiery hatred, the offspring of a nightmare and a dream, this steed feeds on grains grown with the tears of your enemies.

name: Emerald Drake
description: "Is the emerald drake rare?  You have no idea.  If I had a silver for every time someone asked me about one, I could have retired years ago." -Mei Francis

name: Golden Discus
description: An ancient mogu artifact awarded to those who are deeply committed to forms of currency.

name: Infinite Armoredon
description: Even among the armoredon, the possibilities for the future are infinite.

name: Amber Pterrordax
description: The Pterrordax could and would eat you in seconds. Are you sure sitting on its back is a good idea?

name: Algarian Stormrider
description: Flying true even in the harshest conditions, this lightning-infused rook was trained to soar through the skies of the Isle of Dorn and into the depths below.

name: Thundering Jade Cloud Serpent
description: From their infancy, Thundering Cloud Serpents are drawn to storms. They have been known to chase lightning through the blackened, roiling clouds, and to bathe in the pouring rain.

name: Colossal Plaguespew Mawrat
description: These rodents became Iska's infamous sentries, scouting and carrying her plague across the Maw. Their presence is only followed by ruin.

name: Mogu Hazeblazer
description: This ancient mogu artifact controls ambient fog to enable levitation.

name: Otto
description: Relax. The future will unfold as it was meant to, one way or an otter.

name: Verdant Gladiator's Slitherdrake
description: This drake visited many heroes in their dreams before joining your cause.

name: White War Talbuk
description: Despite their docile nature, talbuks have been known to gore seasoned warriors to death when threatened.

name: Heartseeker Mana Ray
description: Someone once told this mana ray it was adorable. It has been pursuing that positive feeling ever since.

name: Shackled Shadow
description: Who would have guessed that a shadow elemental would make for such a comfortable ride?

name: Frostbrood Proto-Wyrm
description: The same magic of undeath that raised the Frostbrood into the Lich King's service has infused this primal wyrm. Its loyalty and ferocity now serve those who defend Azeroth.

name: Ginormous Grrloc
description: It's the second biggest murloc you've ever seen!

name: Springfur Alpaca
description: The kind nature of alpacas makes them perfect as companions for the intrepid adventurer.

name: Shale Ramolith
description: Earthen have long used ramoliths as beasts of burden due to their hardy nature. Shale ramoliths are considered to be friendlier than most others, though that isn't saying much.

name: Kua'fon
description: Once a little hatchling, raised into a mighty pterrordax by a loving handler. He never did learn to fly.

name: Evening Sun Dreamsaber
description: These dreamsabers are ferocious in battle, yet lethargic and often found lazily outstretched upon open fields. After soaking in the warmth of daylight, their flame flares that much brighter.

name: Gilnean Prowler
description: A scrupulous breed of prowlers whose ferocity can only be matched by that of the worgen. These decisive creatures embody discipline and a controlled viciousness that even the worgen have come to admire.

name: Perfected Juggernaut
description: Perfection, like beauty, is in the eye of the beholder. But eyesight can be surgically enhanced.

name: Grotto Netherwing Drake
description: After traveling to Outland and back, it's only natural these drakes seek out new skies.

name: Armored Golden Pterrordax
description: Painted and adorned with gold, these Pterrordax patrol the skies over the tomb of Atal'Dazar.

name: Alunira
description: For so long, the very embodiment of the clouds laid trapped atop a mountain of lightning. And at last, I can feel the wind at my back once again.

name: Explorer's Stonehide Packbeast
description: A true explorer never stays in one place for long. Having a reliable packbeast with a strong back and sturdy legs is essential for travel.

name: Yellow Scouting Ottuk
description: The yellow scouting ottuk love to hide and they blend in well to their surroundings. When not 'playing' hide and seek with their riders, they are perfect companions when scouting enemy encampments.

name: Forged Gladiator's Fel Bat
description: Awakened from caves in the battlefield, and armored to the fray.

name: Vicious Dreamtalon
description: This feline beast's preferred prey is the Alliance.

name: Vicious Moonbeast
description: Unlike most of its kind, this moonbeast has a taste for Alliance blood and an affinity for the color red.

name: Shadowed Swarmite
description: Swarmites are a common sight both in the wilds of Azj-Kahet and among the nerubians who have long domesticated them, but that doesn't make them any less dangerous to incautious adventurers.

name: Maldraxxian Corpsefly
description: Corpseflies were once found throughout Maldraxxus, but many died out in the absence of anima. With anima flowing once again, they swarm.

name: Golden Regal Scarab
description: Plated with gold and socketed with emeralds, this scarab is fit to fly royalty in style.

name: Earthen Ordinant's Ramolith
description: Beneath the stone surface beats a heart emboldened by order to set this world free from darkness.

name: Prototype Leaper
description: An ancient schematic allows for the instantiation of this early, but functional, bufonid design.

name: Verdant Skitterfly
description: Verdant skitterflies are the perfect mount for the scouts of the Dragonscale Expedition scouts, as they are fast and blend into the foliage of the Dragon Isles.

name: Salatrancer
description: While most salamanthers' attention jumps freely from one attraction to the next, this one enjoys long periods of deep observation.

name: Ravenous Black Gryphon
description: War corrupted these once-proud creatures. The susurration of their wings now whispers omens of imminent demise.

name: Snowfluff Dreamtalon
description: As lighthearted and gentle as the snow, they can bounce from one snowdrift to the next without leaving a print.

name: Underlight Corrupted Behemoth
description: The light from the saddle helps attract prey to this corrupted behemoth.

name: Vermillion Imperial Lynx
description: Imperial lynxes are considered to be an Arathi's greatest companion, both on and off the battlefield. Sadly, this lynx's previous owner died in battle.

name: Colossal Soulshredder Mawrat
description: The incredible prowess you have demonstrated within the Jailer's Tower has instilled sufficient respect into this fearsome creature, enabling its use as a mount.

name: Ivory Goliathus
description: Giant beetles that spend their lives in the darkest tunnels of Khaz Algar.  Though they are deprived even of the faintest glimmer of artificial sunlight, they still thrive.

name: Vicious Moonbeast
description: Unlike most of its kind, this moonbeast has a taste for Horde blood and an affinity for the color blue.

name: Patient Bufonid
description: Some bufonids will sit perfectly still for hours or days at a time if left to their own devices. Fortunately, they're also quite agreeable if a rider would like to move more often than that.

name: Battlefield Swarmer
description: Corpseflies are strongly attracted to the smell of dead bodies and will swarm an active battlefield as soon as the first corpse falls.

name: Trained Icehoof
description: It wasn't until you owned this mount that you understood how much the world of Draenor would test you. Clefthoof hair gets in everything!

name: Coldflame Infernal
description: The strange icy flames cause you to sweat and shiver at the same time.

name: Heartbond Lupine
description: From the moment of its creation, this packless lupine has held nothing more than deepest affection and loyalty towards you.

name: Arctic Wolf
description: Once thought to be nearly extinct, this wolf can still occasionally be seen in the company of a few Horde veterans

name: Summer Wilderling
description: Stubborn and rebellious, this wilderling is loyal to very few. But those few are bonded for life.

name: Obsidian Gravewing
description: In the darkened skies of Revendreth, you cannot see these creatures coming until it is too late.

name: Dragon Isles Drake Model Test
description: NYI

name: Blisterback Bloodtusk
description: The House of the Chosen train their mounts in all manner of difficult circumstances, so that no matter the battle, they will never falter.

name: Battle-Hardened Aquilon
description: The aquilon can be a valuable ally in combat, with capabilities exceeding those of the phalynx.

name: Dark Phoenix
description: Despite their name, Dark Phoenixes are known to have a warm and cheerful disposition.

name: Hulking Deathroc
description: Deathrocs are stitched monstrosities from the discarded viscera, bone, and organs that were not required to construct soldiers for the House of Constructs.

name: Alabaster Thunderwing
description: Chiseled by the stoneworkers of Orgrimmar, this stone wind rider is a symbol of the unwavering strength of the Horde.

name: Green Mechanostrider
description: "The terradynamic exo-plotters are conjoined by hydraulic imaging to the equilibrium enhancers..." -Binjy Featherwhistle

name: Corrupted Dreadwing
description: Bathed in the blood of demons, these corrupted Dread Ravens are significantly more aggressive, and will often kill one another if kept in confinement.

name: Gilded Riding Crane
description: It is said that an emperor once paid a large sum for a golden crane. Upon discovering that the crane was only colored like that of the precious metal, he hid with shame in his bedchambers for a week.

name: X-53 Touring Rocket
description: Riding a giant cylinder filled with highly explosive goblin rocket fuel all by yourself is just crazy...so bring a friend.

name: Darnassian Nightsaber
description: When a night elf's mount perishes, it is custom for the rider to keep one of the saber's great fangs as a token of remembrance.

name: Predatory Plagueroc
description: Gieger's everlasting hunger is legendary amongst the House of Constructs, and no beast is too large or bony to fit inside its massive stomach.

name: Grand Gryphon
description: Gryphons' keen eyesight allows them to see over vast distances and warn their riders of any dangers that lie ahead.

name: Palomino
description: Human nobles have long favored this majestic breed for its beautiful golden coat and flowing white mane.

name: Great Red Elekk
description: Never seen in Nagrand, the first red elekk calves were born in Azeroth after the Exodar's arrival. Some breeders theorize that the unique coloration is somehow caused by the same radiation which ravaged Bloodmyst Isle.

name: Drake of the South Wind
description: Gentle as a summer breeze, but that says little considering where it came from. -Itesh

name: Little Red Riding Goat
description: What this goat lacks in size, it makes up for in stubbornness.

name: Farseer's Raging Tempest
description: Windfury. Overload: (2).

name: Mecha-Mogul Mk2
description: The Mk2 is an updated design with a focus on comfort and reliability over firepower.

name: Deepstar Aurelid
description: As one of the last remaining polyps of an elusive creature, this aurelid is at home in the water as much as the air.

name: Swift Breezestrider
description: Draenei have relied on this mount, the swiftest of all talbuk, to relay messengers and their missives safely to their destinations.

name: Plainswalker Bearer
description: The mammoths of the Ohn'ahran Plains are unaccustomed to carrying people, as their centaur neighbors do not typically ride mounts. They can learn to bear riders, however. Some even do so enthusiastically.

name: White Kodo
description: "The kodo is the backbone of our people. Wherever the Horde goes - in trade, settlement, or war - there you will find the mighty kodo." - Harb Clawhoof

name: Wild Dreamrunner
description: Dreamrunners flit between this world and the Emerald Dream at will, reveling in their wild nature.

name: Shellack
description: Fed by victory and hardened by glory, this snail is nothing less than a tribute to mastery.

name: Ancestral Clefthoof
description: This clefthoof has seen ages pass, witnessing everything and patiently teaching many to ride.

name: Grand Armored Gryphon
description: This noble gryphon is as staunch a battle companion as any member of the Alliance could ask for.

name: Jade Pterrordax
description: This favored mount of the Zandalari is a great singer, or so it thinks.

name: Renewed Magmammoth
description: Reforged after destruction at the hands of the Druids of the Flame, this magmammoth is ready to stomp any foes in its path.

name: Pattie
description: Preservationist Kathos encountered Pattie on her first assignment to Vol'dun. Pattie developed an affinity to Preservationist work but is eager to delve deeper, helping adventurers in their sleuthing.

name: Majestic Azure Peafowl
description: The peafowl is renowned for its stunning colors and plumage.

name: Vespoid Flutterer
description: A flutterer is an overgrown vespoid worker created to carry a rider. Rather than looking to a queen for leadership, it looks to its rider to guide it in all things.

name: Ivory Trader's Ottuk
description: No adult knows why some ottuks are white, but any tuskarr child can tell you: it's because they eat too much snow.

name: Vicious Skyflayer
description: This creature hungers for battle with the contemptible Alliance.

name: Raven Lord
description: The rest be forgotten to walk upon the ground, clipped wings and shame. -Word of the Raven

name: Riverwalker Mushan
description: The Mushan is a voracious beast. Though it can be tamed, it will demand a second, third, and even fourth breakfast every day.

name: Mag'har Direwolf
description: Native to Draenor, these wolves are preferred by the Mag'har for their ferocity, loyalty, and for something to snuggle on those cool winter nights.

name: Crowd Pummeler 2-30
description: Guaranteed to knock the teeth out from your enemies with a single punch!

name: Morsel Sniffer
description: A breed of shalewings trained by the niffen to find the deepest of morsels.

name: Furious Gladiator's Frost Wyrm
description: Some of Azeroth's mightiest dragons have been summoned across the veil between life and death to serve new masters with undying loyalty.

name: Shimmermist Runner
description: Mischievous spriggans and the valerunners have a natural enmity. No valerunner would deign to allow a spriggan rider because they can sense their inherent malevolence. This angers the trickster spriggans who take twisted enjoyment in playing cruel pranks on these majestic creatures.

name: Noble Flying Carpet
description: Mages celebrating Noblegarden turned their ordinary festive decor into floating spectacles, only to have them stolen by an angry druid.

name: Purple Shado-Pan Riding Tiger
description: "When waking a tiger, use a long stick. Better yet, tell your friend to wake the tiger instead." -Pandaren Proverb

name: Dune Scavenger
description: These resilient scavengers can survive for months in the wastes of Vol'dun with scarce access to food and water.

name: Twilight Sky Prowler
description: Dubbed the midnight trickster by some, many a couple points to him as the reason their paths crossed in the night.

name: Brown Scouting Ottuk
description: Wily and playful in their natural habitat, ottuks possess keen eyes that can scout far afield as ably as they watch for predators.

name: Grotto Netherwing Drake
description: After traveling to Outland and back, it's only natural these drakes seek out new skies.

name: Red Qiraji War Tank
description: The Qiraji War Tank has only been seen recently during the Call of the Scarab, could this hint at a resurfacing of the deadly creatures?

name: Anointed Protostag
description: Only those most esteemed by the Enlightened are trusted with the reins of this rare cervid.

name: Remembered Wind Rider
description: Hundreds of battles across a dozen campaigns have been fought and won on the backs of these honored creatures.

name: Green Riding Nether Ray
description: Nether Rays are among the most trusted, versatile mounts in all of Outland and beyond.

name: Cerulean Ruinstrider
description: Talbuks, native to Argus, have evolved chitinous plates to survive the decades of ceaseless war that ravages the landscape.

name: Fur-endship Fox
description: These magical creatures thrive on love and friendship.

name: Silver Riding Crane
description: This tall bird is one of the most graceful and elegant cranes, slightly moreso than the Bronze Crane but less than the Golden Crane.

name: Icy Blue Mechanostrider Mod A
description: This historic piece of gnomish engineering was forced into retirement due to its extremely "touchy" gyroscometer.

name: Grand Ice Mammoth
description: Due to high winds and avalanches, the Sons of Hodir recommend bringing at least two companions if venturing into the dangerous Storm Peaks.

name: Ivory Raptor
description: Bred from the fiercest stock anywhere and guaranteed not to bite (much).

name: Red Wolf
description: Almost none remain in the whole of Azeroth; only the most experienced will have seen one.

name: Sky Surfer
description: An ancient mogu artifact awarded to those who are deeply committed to the skies.

name: Temperamental Skyclaw
description: Slyverns are rarely comfortable acting as mounts. Only those willing to feed their gluttonous appetites and keep a careful eye on them should attempt to ride.

name: Ironbound Wraithcharger
description: Its ethereal spirit is barely contained by its iron shell. The penultimate creation of Salanar the Horseman, these powerful steeds were once thought to have all been destroyed.

name: Ochre Dreamtalon
description: Playful dreamtalons often decorate themselves in a myriad of colors that only autumn offers.

name: Feathered Windsurfer
description: "Check the current windspeed and elevation before mounting. Avoid trees and other tall objects. Damaged kites are ineligible for return or refund." - Windsurfer's Instruction Manual

name: Marble Quilen
description: Created by a mogu sorcerer who breathed life into their favorite pet rock.

name: Grand Black War Mammoth
description: Once used by giants to carry heavily armored warriors, these grand war mammoths can easily bear more than one rider of less-than-giant stature.

name: Mimiron's Jumpjets
description: Created as a prototype by Mimiron. The pieces were stolen from his workshop, sold, and lost to time. That is until now..

name: Flourishing Whimsydrake
description: These playful protectors of the Emerald Dream may be larger than their faerie dragon relatives, but they are no less mischievous.

name: Warhorse
description: Trained to stand firm in righteous combat.

name: Gilded Ravasaur
description: A mount fit for Zandalari high priests and councilers, gilded with only the finest decoration and blessed by Rezan, the great devilsaur loa.

name: Armored Red Dragonhawk
description: This rare breed of dragonhawk is a mark of honor in the Horde, gifted by the blood elves. It reflects your tireless effort to amass a small army of mounts.
